name: Aisha Azmi
text: Really had a great stay. Im so blessed with the given room. Perfect view of New Year Celebration with affordable and reasonable price tbh. Eventho the fireworks view was 5 star show which im afraid my son definitely gonna woke up but my son sleep safe and sound. (I prepared earmuff, incase) - love the soundproof of the hotel. hehe. Im so happy. Breakfast - perfect, everything so delicious. Just need extra “sabar” for the replenishment due to PH, but im okay with it. My son happy, im happy and my husband surely will be happy too staying at this hotel. Accessible to the curve, IKEA, Lotus etc. Easy peasy. Will come back for sure.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Siti Besri
text:
We had an outstanding wedding experience at Royal Chulan Damansara. From start to finish, the service was exceptional.

A special thank you to the best hotel coordinator, Sarah Benjamin, who managed the Grand Ballroom flawlessly and ensured all family hotel rooms were perfectly arranged and well taken care of. Her professionalism, calmness, and attention to detail truly made everything seamless.

The food was absolutely excellent — huge appreciation to Chef Haniff and his sous chef for delivering delicious dishes that impressed all our guests. We received so many compliments, and everyone was genuinely happy and satisfied with the food.

Thank you Royal Chulan Damansara team for making our wedding memorable, smooth, and truly special. Highly recommended for anyone looking for top-notch wedding service and hospitality.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Siti Ghazali
text:
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
We would like to express our sincere appreciation to Chef Muhamad Haniff Bin Hj. Ahmad Sukri (Malay Chef), and the culinary team for the excellent food served during our daughter’s wedding reception at Royal Chulan Damansara on 20 December 2025.

The dishes were beautifully presented, rich in flavor, and consistently delicious. Many of our guests complimented the quality, taste, and variety of the food, making the evening even more memorable.

Thank you, Chef Muhamad Haniff, for your dedication and for contributing to such a wonderful and unforgettable celebration.

Sincerely
Zul,Siti, Fiqah, Luqman & Daniel
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

The GSA answered very negatively " selalunya kalau barang tanya dekat sana. Jangan tanya dekat sini tu bukan kerja kitorang ". Mind you, this is 5 star hotel and is this the correct way to answer your guest ? Team please check your team members unwelcoming behavior. Date 27/12/2025 Time 4:00pm. GSA wearing hijab. Al Hafizan

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Arif_Ibrahim68
text: Me and my family stayed here for 2 nites to attend a big family event nearby. The location is very strategic - easy access to main roads and highways. Also, just next to The Curve Mall which has many excellent restaurants and cafes. Ikea, KidZania and other interesting places are just walking distance.||We booked directly way in advance and we felt the room rates is very reasonable.||The rooms we stayed (4 rooms) are all decent although quite dated but still fully functional. ||My issues with this hotel are mostly related to its customer service. Firstly, we’re not sure whether this hotel has concierge services. It’s almost none existence when we were there. They are some people at the main entrance who wore security guard uniform. They did help us with our luggages when we first arrive but when we checked-out those guys with security uniform didn’t even bother to help with our luggages. Not sure whether they are security guards or the hotel concierge team.||The front desk team is efficient but not exactly the friendliest we have dealt with. A simple smile would have made them looks more friendlier.||The other area we’re not impressed was the services at the coffee house during the buffet breakfast. Granted that we were there during peak period with high occupancy rate but they should have been better prepared for the big crowd. The foods and drinks took way too long to be refilled. And whose “brilliant” idea to offer table-to-table personalised sandwich-making services during the peak period? Just make sure the basics are up to the mark first before offering this unnecessary fancy services.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Marnie Love
text:
Very disappointing experience. I waited 2 hours just to get a towel!
I called the operator multiple times, and they said housekeeping would be informed, but nothing happened.
No follow-up, no sense of urgency, and no service recovery at all.Al
Definitely not coming back.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Liew Eva
text:
21號入住，五樓。
首先停車場有EV charger，非常棒（但沒機會用😅就離開了）；

3點半辦理入住很順暢（沒有遇到其他住客投訴般的情況）；

這家hotel被Google標為5🌟，但房間的地毯有一股很重的類似腳氣味的霉味（用香水都無法掩蓋的嚴重）。再檢查了一下其他備品，發現房務沒有提供毛巾，我只能到門外和房務人員索取，外籍房務員很友善（這很明顯是房務部經理在把房間交給櫃檯時沒有做好自己的工作）；晚上外出回到房間，又發現浴室沒有腳踏毛巾，一家合格的飯店應該會提供吧…？已經很累也懶得打電話到櫃檯請人送上來了……

除了以上不好的，其他都還可以，尤其是它的地理位置。不論是開車或是搭MRT都可以去到多間購物商場，非常便利。

房間的價格算合理，但如果不是因為隔天行程安排和目的地的地理位置問題，我想以同樣的價格，我會選擇住另外一間更常住的。
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Paez John
text: Despite the booking being fully paid well in advance, we were denied our room until 7:00 PM, even though the stated check-in time was 3:00 PM. After traveling a long distance, we were made to wait nearly four hours in the lobby with no proper explanation or accountability. This is completely unacceptable and demonstrates a serious failure in service standards and management competence.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Tung Hsu
text: Hotel service people Very Friendly
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: azue zakaria
text:
Significant Check-In Delay with Poor Service Recovery

I stayed at Royale Chulan Damansara from 13–14 December. The room itself was acceptable; however, the check-in process reflected serious operational shortcomings.

Although the official check-in time is 3:00 PM, I only received my room key at 4:27 PM. This was despite being informed shortly after 3:00 PM that a room was already available and being asked to collect my key. I joined the queue at 3:11 PM, with only two to three guests ahead of me, yet the process took over an hour due to inefficient coordination at the front desk.

This delay caused me to miss a scheduled makeup appointment and disrupted my preparation for an important evening event. No proactive explanation or meaningful service recovery was offered at the time.

The following day, a modest late check-out request was initially declined and only approved after further explanation, despite the significantly delayed check-in.

I understand the hotel was fully booked; however, high occupancy does not justify missed service standards or inadequate recovery efforts. Based on this experience, the overall service did not align with the expectations set by the hotel’s reputation.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Eddie Eddiemisai
text:
Need a rest n relax here
Awesome
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Ain Nurintan
text:
Extremely disappointing and unprofessional experience at Royal Chulan Damansara.

On 13 December 2025, my family and I arrived at 1.00 PM for check-in, having booked seven rooms. We were informed the rooms were not ready and were asked to wait until 3.00 PM. We waited patiently. At 3.00 PM, the rooms were still not ready, and no clear explanation or apology was given.

What followed was six hours of waiting in the lobby. Room keys were released slowly and inconsistently, and the final two rooms were only handed over at 7.00 PM, and only after we raised our voices in frustration. It should never require confrontation for guests to receive what they have already paid for.

Throughout this entire period:
•	There were no sincere apologies from front desk staff or management.
•	The General Manager did not properly address the situation and was seen walking past without acknowledging us.
•	No refreshments or proper seating arrangements were offered, despite children and elderly family members (including guests in their 80s) being present.
•	Front desk staff openly discussed housekeeping failures in front of guests, which was highly unprofessional.
•	Other hotel guests looked at us as though we were not paying customers, which was humiliating.

The most telling moment was that a bell boy showed more empathy and professionalism than the front desk or management by offering us a luggage trolley to sit on. That alone speaks volumes.

This incident occurred the day before a family wedding, turning what should have been a calm and meaningful time into one of stress, exhaustion, and frustration. We chose this hotel based on its reputation and reviews, but the reality fell far short of the standards it claims to uphold.

Regardless of whether a guest books one room or seven, every paying customer deserves basic dignity, communication, and hospitality. Unfortunately, none of these were demonstrated here.

This experience was unacceptable. I would not recommend this hotel based on our experience.

- Update: After receiving the keys, the manager explained that he thought one of us was hotel staff sitting on the floor (because he was wearing black - hence why he didn’t approach us) What kind if idiotic reasoning is this. Then, he further explained that the lateness is due to outsourcing of bedsheet linens that arrived at 5.30PM. Yet, we only received our rooms after 7PM.

Moreover, after entering our rooms, only one towel was provided per room. Is this really a 4 star hotel? Nonsense!
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: We arrived at the hotel around 6:00 PM, but our room was still not ready. The staff gave us a key card, but when we reached the room, the door was locked from the inside. We knocked many times before a housekeeping staff finally opened the door, looking like they just woke up, and told us the room was not prepared at all. We were left waiting outside for more than 30 minutes, which is completely unacceptable.Around 9:00 PM, the room next door became very noisy for hours. It sounded like a big family gathering — loud talking, kids running, knocking on doors. It felt unsafe and made it impossible to rest.Communication with the hotel was also terrible. Many operators could not understand English, and shockingly, some couldn’t even understand basic Malay. We had to call many times just to get someone to pick up the phone.For a double room, the hotel only provided one towel and one toothbrush, showing the room was not properly prepared at all.This whole experience was extremely disappointing — late check-in, room not ready, poor communication, noise and safety issues, and lack of basic amenities. The hotel seriously needs to improve its standards.我们大概下午6点到酒店，结果房间竟然还没准备好。前台给了我们房卡，我们去到房间时发现房门从里面反锁。我们敲了好几次，里面的清洁员才开门，而且一脸像刚睡醒，说房间根本还没整理。我们就这样被迫站在门口等了超过30分钟，非常离谱。到了晚上9点左右，隔壁房间开始非常吵，像一家人开派对一样，不停敲门、讲话、走动，吵了好几个小时，严重影响安全感和休息。酒店沟通也很糟糕。很多接线员听不懂英语，更夸张的是连简单的马来语也听不懂。我们打了好几通电话过去都没人接，拖了很久才有人回应。另外，我们住的是双人房，却只给了一条毛巾和一支牙刷。根本不像是准备好的房间。整段住宿体验真的非常差：延迟入住、房间没准备、设施不足、服务沟通不良、隔壁吵闹、安全隐患，全部都集中在同一天发生。酒店管理真的需要全面改进。

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: TTTKK Khor
text:
We arrived at the hotel around 6:00 PM, but our room was still not ready. The staff gave us a key card, but when we reached the room, the door was locked from the inside. We knocked many times before a housekeeping staff finally opened the door, looking like they just woke up, and told us the room was not prepared at all. We were left waiting outside for more than 30 minutes, which is completely unacceptable.

Around 9:00 PM, the room next door became very noisy for hours. It sounded like a big family gathering — loud talking, kids running, knocking on doors. It felt unsafe and made it impossible to rest.

Communication with the hotel was also terrible. Many operators could not understand English, and shockingly, some couldn’t even understand basic Malay. We had to call many times just to get someone to pick up the phone.

For a double room, the hotel only provided one towel and one toothbrush, showing the room was not properly prepared at all.

This whole experience was extremely disappointing — late check-in, room not ready, poor communication, noise and safety issues, and lack of basic amenities. The hotel seriously needs to improve its standards.

我们大概下午6点到酒店，结果房间竟然还没准备好。前台给了我们房卡，我们去到房间时发现房门从里面反锁。我们敲了好几次，里面的清洁员才开门，而且一脸像刚睡醒，说房间根本还没整理。我们就这样被迫站在门口等了超过30分钟，非常离谱。

到了晚上9点左右，隔壁房间开始非常吵，像一家人开派对一样，不停敲门、讲话、走动，吵了好几个小时，严重影响安全感和休息。

酒店沟通也很糟糕。很多接线员听不懂英语，更夸张的是连简单的马来语也听不懂。我们打了好几通电话过去都没人接，拖了很久才有人回应。

另外，我们住的是双人房，却只给了一条毛巾和一支牙刷。根本不像是准备好的房间。

整段住宿体验真的非常差：延迟入住、房间没准备、设施不足、服务沟通不良、隔壁吵闹、安全隐患，全部都集中在同一天发生。酒店管理真的需要全面改进。

name: Trip.com Member
text: I booked this hotel because I had to attend a conference at One World Hotel and it costs a lot more to stay there for 2 nights. This hotel has designated parking for customers, and is only few min from the other hotel I had to go. It is located near the curve, Ikea and IPC which makes it very convenient for us. Location and parking availability wise, it’s perfect. Ambience of the hotel is good too. Looks fancy and nice. The room was a bit old but really spacious and I love the deco too. The only two unfortunate events was that we had to wait thirty min ish to check in even though we arrived at 6pm. We were only given our access card around 6:35pm but we were not reimbursed with a late checkout. The other time was a lift breakdown around 10pm when hub wanted to pick me up but no signage were put at our floor. Hub waited and ended up walking down ten floors worth of stairs 😂 only to find out that the lift broke down. Anyway, it was resolved by the time we reached back at the hotel. Breakfast was basic but good enough to fill our stomach. Overall I would give a 4.5/5 for this stay.

name: Trip.com Member
text: Check-in was smooth and efficient. The receptionist was courteous and proactive, kindly assisting me in switching from the originally booked twin room near the lift to a quieter king-size room, which I greatly appreciated.Breakfast was satisfactory, though seating was limited to outdoor tables with no air conditioning. When I asked a staff member to clear a table, she appeared indifferent and disengaged, offering no greeting or smile. Fortunately, another team member responded promptly and courteously, preparing a table swiftly and professionally.While the parking fee was minimal at RM4, complimentary parking for overnight guests would be a welcome gesture and help streamline the arrival/exit process. Additionally, clearer signage is needed to indicate that the car park entrance is located behind stalls set up along the usual access road, as this caused some confusion.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

We chose to stay here for  3 days, and this place is nowhere near the standards of a five-star facility. Not recommended for a family holiday.

name: J S
text:
I stayed at Royale Chulan Hotel in Kuala Lumpur in November 2022. The hotel was very clean, spacious, and well maintained. The rooms felt comfortable and elegant. There were a few minor repair issues inside the room, but they did not affect the overall stay.

The experience during our short visit was very good. The atmosphere was pleasant and the property felt welcoming. I would choose this hotel again on my next trip to Malaysia.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Muhd Nurhambali
text:
Every year, my wife and I choose this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This year was even more special as we brought our baby along for the first time.

Thank you to the hotel for the thoughtful complimentary cake and chocolates — it truly made our stay extra memorable.

The room was spacious, and very comfortable. The staff were friendly, attentive, and always ready to help. The location is excellent, convenient, and easily accessible.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience and we will definitely continue this yearly tradition.

Lokasi pun strategik, dekat Pavilion & KLCC. Cuma beberapa fasiliti nampak sedikit lama, tapi keseluruhan pengalaman tetap memuaskan. TV tak tahu nak guna macam mana tiada siaran ke?

text: I have event here at Royal Chulan KL, the maintainence team was superb, and very helpful. It seems to me that Mr Faris and team help me not because of it was their job, but it was their passion to deliver the best, to make the outcome as perfect as it can be. Kudos to them
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Sonia Jain
text: The room was quite spacious which included a king size bed. Great location considering it is next to Pavillion mall and near to MRT station too. Great place for couples.We had a genuinely awesome stay at the Royale Chulan. The hotel's fantastic location, excellent breakfast, and responsive management made our trip memorable. Highlights: Outstanding Location & Access: The hotel offers incredibly easy access to the Conlay MRT station, making it a perfect base for exploring Kuala Lumpur. It's also just a short walk down the road to Pavilion Bukit Bintang, putting you right in the heart of the action. Navigating Bukit Bintang and the Golden Triangle by foot or MRT was effortless. Fantastic Breakfast Spread: The breakfast was a real highlight. The spread was fantastic, with a wide variety of options to suit all tastes—a great way to start the day. Excellent Service Recovery: While we experienced a power outage on our first night, the hotel management handled it superbly. To compensate for the inconvenience, the manager offered us a late check-out, which we greatly appreciated.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

I always loved how she served guests with such warmth! Honestly, one of the reasons I kept coming back to Royale Chulan was because of her excellent service. Gonna miss seeing her at F&B! 💛

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Izyan Abdullah
text:
i rarely give a long review because I'm not a fussy person, but this time I just have to. I bought voucher during MATTA fair and reserved one month early prior to my stay, confirmed by email. during checkin, they ask for the voucher. however, in the confirmation email, there is no reminder plus in the voucher itself also didn't stated that voucher must be present upon checkin. nevertheless, they let me checkin but need to present the voucher before checkout. later they whatsapp me the same reminder with additional info; if I failed to present the voucher, I'll be charged with a walkin rate rm300 (company policy they said). I have a long chat in the WhatsApp on how unfair that is to charge twice for the stay. finally they explain if I paid the 300,the voucher can be used another time. if they explained earlier about that, the long conversation will not exist. fortunately, my house is around 20mins from the hotel and I retrieved the voucher. my point is, kindly inform early the guest on the voucher usage and your company policy. please state in the voucher and confirmation email to bring along voucher upon checkin.
Next, when I pass the voucher to the counter after breakfast, the lady counter smirked and chuckled at me. if you cannot respect people who bought your voucher, don't offer voucher next time. I am utterly disappointed. this should be long enough.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Awin Bakar
text:
I stayed at Royale Chulan Damansara recently and was extremely disappointed with the food hygiene. I found a cockroach in my breakfast meal, which is completely unacceptable for a hotel of this standard.

I immediately informed the staff, but there was no proper response or follow-up from the management. This shows poor handling of a serious food safety issue.

Even more frustrating, I did multiple written complaints to management but theres no proper follow up from their end.

I hope the hotel takes this matter seriously and improves their kitchen hygiene and customer service — no guest should ever experience something like this.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Overall good experience. My first stay and will return again.

The tv screen was not very clear, better you watch movie from your phone. The food also was average 🥲 (i booked room include breakfast).I think the hotel need to improve their service because royale chulan is a 5 star hotel.

title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: DERP Face
text:
This is the longest review but pls read.

Not a 5 star hotel and very deceiving as stated! At most 4 star! We stayed at the premium suite. The room is like u go back in time with old decor n furnishings with 2 old 32" tv although its clean.

2nd day evening is where e nightmare begins! The room is crawling with cockroaches on the walls, floor and we have to go around trapping and smacking them.

Aside from that, hotel has a small gym compared to a regular condo gym. The equipments are poorly maintained. There is also a pool which is chalky n poorly maintained. I advice guests not to swim in it and just look at it as u may fall sick. There are no steam room or sauna like other regular "5 star" hotels!

The premium lounge is unlike other 5 star hotels too the food is never topped up and have very very limited options. My entire life this is e least options of all e 5 star hotels i have stayed in. My regular condo clubhouse has a more exclusive feel to it then this 5 star lounge. Dont bother going there.

Breakfast is good but 99% crowded with India tourists so it can get pretty noisy from all the yelling and they have very special seating for them, normal or premium club guests are not allowed to sit there or e servers will stare at u n make u feel uncomfortable.

Last but not least, we truly regret our stay here and decide not to continue our stay here and move to Sheraton hotel and about the same price for a club suite. Its wonderful and we feel the exclusivity compared to this hotel. We will NEVER stay at this hotel anymore for our future trips in future.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Shivaji Rp
text: Best rate & best service
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: 吉隆坡皇家朱兰酒店距离Pavilion购物中心、武吉免登和吉隆坡会议中心都很近，出行十分便利 。  酒店的大厅宽敞大气，充满了老牌五星酒店的气质，复古豪华的装修风格让人仿佛置身于另一个时代。办理入住时，门童会热情地帮忙迎接并拿行李送到房间，服务非常周到 。  客房空间很大，卫生状况良好，卫生间是干湿分离的，没有异味。房间内的设施带有浓厚的老钱风，雕花铁艺、丝绒沙发等家具尽显奢华。部分阳台房还能看到双子塔的美景，在浴缸中泡澡的同时欣赏城市风光，十分惬意。  酒店的早餐种类丰富，以印度和马来风味为主，也有少量西式餐点 。如果吃不惯当地口味，可能会觉得选择有限 。酒店还设有泳池、健身房、SPA等设施，可以满足不同客人的需求。不过，泳池旁边空调外机的声音较大，会影响在此处的体验 。 总的来说，吉隆坡皇家朱兰酒店地理位置优越，服务贴心，房间宽敞舒适，虽然存在一些小缺点，但不影响整体的入住体验，适合对住宿品质有一定要求的游客入住，毕竟价格也不便宜呀，哈哈哈哈哈哈
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Jaslynn Looi
text:
Edit: 22 Oct, finally had a proper answer from them. I must commend Helmi on his service and professionalism. And your management needs to work on their communication.

Honestly the worst service I have encountered for a 5 star establishment.

Stayed in early Sept, and on the last night at 2am, a pipe burst on our floor, causing water to flood into our rooms. When we called reception to ask what was going on, they only mentioned a pipe had burst and are trying to rectify it. No apology, no change of room was offered despite us mentioning that our rooms carpet floors are soaked. When we opened the door, we saw the opposite 2 rooms and the room beside us all had towels placed at their doors, except us.

Checked out the in the morning, floor smells of damp carpet and when we left the bed, it was so unpleasant to walk on and pack. Utterly ridiculous.

What made it worse was when we checked out and mentioned our experience to front desk, the staff had no idea what had happened or seem to know that a pipe had burst on our floor. Asked for a refund for the last night, staff said to follow up.

Sent an email that very same day, no reply from them despite sending another few, days apart.
Called in and spoke to the staff regarding my issue and a refund, all promised to follow up the next day but nothing was followed through. They have my name, my number and my email. I've called in on 4 separate occasions and until now, empty promises of having someone call me back with updates are still not fulfilled.

It has been almost 2 months, this is utterly ridiculous.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Royale Chulan has been put regular hotel when ever we come to KL. They have changed their parking rates which is RM4 per stay which is better than previously RM5/day.Room was ok, but TV is too small. I know that club floor has bigger TV as I've stayed in club floor before. Service wise, all staff from reception to coffee house are friendly and polite. Thumbs up to them.

text:
The room was excellent. decent for its price. However, i can only complaint on their buffet. Thats Rm38 per person add on. Variety ok la. The standard servings for decent hotel. But refill was very slow. 4-5 minutes per food variety? And despite there is plenty of tables to sit onto, there are spots that felt quite hot (especially the big tables area).

Anyway, the rest is good. Facility, gym, swimming pool and the spa. But i probably expected too much when you have your twins just beside with a better suit up.

Thanks!

With the price n location, i can consider to revisit this hotel in the future. The location is just beside The Curve and Mutiara Damansara MRT station. The toilet is the best. name: Irfan Ahn
text:
I recently visited Hotel Royal Chulan Damansara to try out their breakfast buffet, and I must say—it’s one of the best value-for-money breakfast spreads I’ve come across. At just RM29.90, the variety and quality offered are genuinely impressive.

🍽️ Wide Array of Local and International Dishes
The buffet caters to both local and Western palates. You’ll find classic Malaysian staples like nasi lemak, complete with fragrant coconut rice, sambal, and condiments. For those craving something heartier, there’s spaghetti and other hot dishes to keep you satisfied.

The bread section is extensive, featuring everything from sliced loaves to muffins, with a toaster station for that perfect crunch. If you’re a cereal fan, they’ve got you covered too—with options like Honey Stars, a nostalgic local favorite.

👨‍🍳 Live Cooking Station – Eggs Done Your Way
One of the highlights of the buffet is the live cooking station, where a chef prepares omelets right in front of you. It’s not just omelets—you can request your eggs however you like: sunny side up, half-boiled, scrambled, you name it. Watching the chef work adds a lively, interactive touch to the morning experience.

🫓 Roti Canai Heaven
Another standout feature is the roti canai section, which offers a variety of roti options. From the classic roti telur to the crowd-favorite roti sarang burung, you can place your order and enjoy freshly made roti served hot. The sarang burung variation, with its nest-like presentation and egg center, is especially popular and definitely worth trying.

☕ Final Thoughts
Whether you're staying at the hotel or just dropping by for breakfast, this buffet is a hidden gem. The ambiance is relaxed, the staff are attentive, and the food selection is both satisfying and diverse. For under RM30, you get a full breakfast experience that rivals more expensive hotel spreads.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Jono Chong
text:
We check in to this hotel from 2 to 6 Oct.

Its quite affordable per night for a 5 start hotel, given that I paid abit more I get the breakfast included. The breakfast had a Wide spread. Variety of options. Which was excellent. Every morning with almost different menu. For the rooms. I arranged for a superior king with twin beds. Our stay in the room was good. Had a filter water cooler for us to fill our bottles

However just needed to point out an unpleasant experience that without it would have made my review 5 stars no doubt. So here it is.
When we step into our room for the first time. I wanted to use the bathroom. However, the lights were not working. (Tried all options to rectify the situation but could not fix it) Called in reception for help. But only came up 15 mins later. We had to deal with this when we had other plans outside. So the staff said it was power trip and turn the lights on from the circuit box. We thought it was fixed already when other nights, it switched off again which we had to stand up on a chair to switch the circuit box switch on. But then the switch kept switching off when we tried to switch it on. After a few times it worked. I mean this is first time this happened. Think it happened at least 3 times. Staff offered to switch rooms. But we were already so comfortable in our rooms.

Felt that the hotel should have done a better job in checking the rooms. Making sure everything is good. Not saying its ready then when we checked in to the hotel, things don't work. Its a 5 star hotel, we Had our expectations. But other than the 3 nights. The lights did not switch off again when we were using the bathroom. Imagine that moment...
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: YAP KOK CHOUN
text: Good
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Addauwais Foods
text:
Menginap dekat Royal Chulan Kota Damansara ni memang rasa classy tapi masih cozy. Dari luar nampak elegan, tapi bila masuk lobby terus rasa selesa dan bau hotel dia pun ada “luxury but homey” vibe gitu.

Bilik bersih, luas & lengkap, ada meja kerja, aircond sejuk, tilam empuk (jenis yang kalau baring terus lupa dunia).

Bathroom pun bersih & water pressure kuat, love that!

Sarapan buffet dia paling AU suka, variety of foods, ada nasi lemak, omelette station, roti bakar, buah, dan kopi panas yang betul-betul kaw. Tak terlalu banyak pilihan macam hotel besar, tapi semua cukup & sedap.

Staff semua polite & cepat respon bila tanya. Parking pun senang, cuma kalau waktu event / weekend, boleh jadi penuh sikit sebab ramai guest luar datang makan di kafe hotel.

Lokasi strategik, dekat MRT Kota Damansara, The Strand, Sunway Giza, dan banyak port makan best sekitar.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Izammz Izam
text: Good recommended
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Arwa Maher
text: اسوء فندق معفن وكل غرفة نبدلها فيها عيوب

name: Ajay Joshi
text: Neat and clean rooms
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Shahidah Ramdan
text:
The name of this hotel no longer reflects its standard—there is nothing “royal” about it. We checked in close to midnight and were given Room 463, located at the far end of Level 4. Although the room was spacious with wooden décor, our first hour was spent catching cockroaches near the toilet sink. We encountered a total of five.

The next morning, we found yet another cockroach, this time on the TV console. That was the last straw. We called reception and requested a room change.

We were moved to Room 412, but the issues continued. The pillows had an unbearable smell, as if they hadn’t been changed in a very long time. It was disgusting and made it impossible to sleep.

Overall, this was the worst hotel experience I’ve had in Kuala Lumpur.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Abhishek
text:
We recently stayed at Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur , and it was a good experience overall. We had booked the Studio King room, which came with a kitchenette. It was on first floor. Hotel has vintage aesthetics and is located on Jalan Conlay road, and walk able to Pavilion mall, Fahrenheit mall, Bukit Bintag street etc .

The hotel has a very big and grand lobby , your jaw will drop once you enter . Its a quite a small walk to reception desk , I will say. The location is also perfect ,just a few minutes walk from the city center yet peaceful and surrounded by greenery. The check-in process was smooth and the staff were welcoming

The room was spacious enough for two people, clean, well-furnished and with a very high ceiling . But, room lightning could have been better. It was bit dimly lit in my opinion. Moreover,  housekeeping maintained cleanliness throughout our stay.

The restaurant , Warisan Cafe , served food from multiple cuisines- Chinese,Malay, Indian etc ,all had different section, with the veg section in the center of the restaurant. Sitting was comfortable and staff was attentive. The only minor issue was that the veg options were very few, but no complaints with taste.

Overall, Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur offers great value for money for a 5 star rated hotel, with friendly staff, good food, and a relaxing atmosphere. I’d highly recommend it for anyone visiting Kualalumpur .
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Sheerin Mahpor
text:
We had a retirement function yesterday, Saturday 8.11.2025 during Weekend Hi-Tea.
● Thumbs up to the superb, attentive, polite, efficient and excellent manager, ALEX, for ensuring the "private" space was re-arranged to a long "island" layout to accommodate 21 of us for a comfortable function, tables were wiped clean and the floor was swept/mopped.
● Thumbs up to the manager, ALEX, who arranged swiftly for the complimentary cake from Warisan Cafe and made sure that our needs were met.
● Thumbs up to the manager, HERRY, for making rounds on checking that everything was going on accordingly, and for his politeness when in conversation.
● Thumbs up to the waiter who was assigned to us, JOYNEL, who was efficient, polite, attentive, concerned and helpful.
● All staffs of Warisan Cafe had smiles on their faces, and, were warm and courteous.
■ Hi-Tea spread, quality and taste were GOOD! (*however, live kuetiew cooking could have been better if it was not salty, chef!)

◇ Please take note on the leakage/ dripping water from above, in the "private" space.

name: Trip.com Member
text: 会议组织方安排的酒店，看点评普遍说设施陈旧，有心理预期。入住后没想到踩雷的是卫生状况，让人大跌眼镜。￼        预订的阳台房安排到在楼，阳台打开几乎是对着玻璃顶棚，同时有一股浓重的油烟味。想着反正吉隆坡天气热，用不到阳台，无所谓。谁知进房间不到3分钟就发现一只小强，还没来得及处理，就迅速钻到了一个角落里。心想算了吧，眼一闭心一横就当没看见，谁知才不过半分钟功夫洗手台上又爬出两三只，为了不使大家难受就不放视频了。        至此实在没有办法，打电话要求更换房间，接电话时态度还算客气，但到前台后刚才接电话的女士（应该是印度人），明显觉得看到是华人面孔后，反倒态度倨傲，歉意全无，告知同楼层换一间，在我要求到高一点楼层后，被换到10楼。到10楼后发现升级到了大一点的房间，估计这位女士是觉得都给你升级房间了，还想怎么样？但前面的谈话内容并未要求升级，她也没有告知会升级房间。这就是酒店的处理态度？还是当地印度裔也敢歧视对华裔？更换后的房间，马桶是脏的，沙发上有血渍，但舟车劳顿之后实在不愿意再去做沟通了，只好自己想办法消毒。实在是难以想象，这是一家服务于政府的星级酒店￼￼！！！
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Syazwan Nasir
text:
Stayed here for 4D3N. The lobby and ballroom are excellent and well-maintained. The gym is quite small with around 10 pieces of equipment and the swimming pool is clean and decent.

However, the guest rooms really need an upgrade. The furniture and fittings are outdated, and the faucet even came off while I was using it. Housekeeping also missed cleaning my room on the second day, which was disappointing.

Overall, great common areas, but the rooms and service need improvement to match the hotel’s image.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Rajoy
text:
See photos. Staff say no room. Comeback 2hrs later. 10min another staff say room ready.
Dont like dishonesty. From tap broken, no water, shower tray broken, no lights,  tv broken, send me to occupied  room with guest inside, ask me wait till 6pm for other room, when room ready before 3pm. Took 1 hr to change to other room. No apologies. No calls. Worst experience from staff and room. Treated badly a customer for 15years. Not good feeling. Dont like dishonesty. Trust is broken. Staff need to be honest. Customers coming for many years. We know. Staff that are helpful, honest. Think many staff not even employed since I coming many years. Honest mistake, stress, busy, unfriendly etc I ok. But lies, unwilling to help, not calling, keep waiting etc I not ok. This is service issue. Customer feel not taken care of. Lousy feeling.

Update: Fully agree with management response. This is very unusual, in fact this has never happened before. So many years. All good. So many things go wrong in just this stay, Must be my very bad luck and the staff service issue. But I must say many staff are good too. Thank you for your good service.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Azri Hazwan
text:
From the outside the hotel looks simple when step inside very nice got English vibe. The process check in smooth staff very kind and helpful. Got double card it's very nice.

Rooms very nice and tidy beside the furniture looks old fashioned. Got very nice setup and smells good. Bathroom it's separate very convenient and shower have nice water pressure but no bath tub. Got 40 inch android TV can access to YouTube 👍

Having swimming to their infinity pools just nice only just 4ft friendly for kids also have pools for kids.Also got simple gym to try out your stamina. Parking complimentary for guest under the hotel. Also very near to The Curve, IPC and IKEA walking distance around 3 minutes.

Cons here the linens and towels looks worn out. Their lobby looks dull not like a 4 star hotel.

name: Nilla Amigh
text: The hotel is excellent with very polite and friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and the swimming pool is great. Breakfast is good and the location of the hotel is excellent. The only issue was that in the gym, 4 out of 5 treadmills were out of order. I also have a suggestion for making the pool area even better: I kindly ask the management to place umbrellas for the sunbeds, because it is hard to stay under the sun for a long time. I usually share suggestions only for the hotels I truly like, because I want them to become even better.Another very important thing I would like to mention about the rooms is that, please clean and renovate the restrooms. The sinks had mold around their edges, which was really unpleasant. This is a matter of hygiene and should be observed by all hotels, from one-star to five-star
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: A very bad experience for this stay.  Choose this hotel as we stayed long time before and quite satisfied with the facilities and others.  But this time was very disappointing. We were given a room with aircond problem. We feel warm and my child was sweating all the time.  Hotel engineers visited and found no problem at first only the window is opened ask us to wait for a few hours first.  The room was still warm at night.  My baby can’t sleep and keep on sweating. At about 10pm there was an electric cut off.  The current was back normal after 10 mins and cut off suddenly again and normal back a few mins again.  We called and the engineer come again.  He said there was another room guest cause the electric cut off. Just then the engineer also found the room was still warm and can’t found what’s wrong with the aircond.  Then only he ask us to ask the front desk to change the room for us.  Front desk said there was no king bed room for us anymore but we claim that we have baby and we need king size bed anyway.  They said they had offer the baby cot to us(as we request when the time check in ). But the baby cot was shacky and old and it’s not suitable for baby sleeping inside.  We wait for almost half an hour more then only we get the new room with lower floor.  We can smell the smoking smell when the time we enter the room but at least the air cond is cool and comfortable.  The desk was full of ants.  🤣We didn’t ask for housekeeping or changing room again as baby was super tired and need to sleep as it’s ald near to 12am. The next morning we went for breakfast. We had to find the seat by own but not serve by the waiter.  There was an extra room with seat but the aircond was not on.  The coffee house was crowded the food run out fast but it was not refill on time.  The only things need to be praise is they allow us to check out a bit late as the baby sleeping.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: The room is spacious. Just my air condition got problem and they help me to fix it. They ask us to fill evaluation form when check out, the form got so many page that make the customer take a lot time to fill especially when we rushing to airport. Please redo the form.

Car parking is easy and safe.A very comfortable, spacious hotel with various facilities. There is a water filter and wifi internet provided.For me everything is very comfortable and quiet. The room is spacious and worth your money.Very good service, friendly staff made me and my family love staying here. Thank you all.

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Ammar Alkhaliq
text: Having some annual dinner
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Joshua Lee
text:
A very bad experience from the get-go. Check-in process was messy and slow. The back counter guys were not even trying to "traffic control" and had my queue overtaken by other guests that just walk over even though I was already standing there.

The room was okay except it being HAZARDOUS and NOT SAFE for living. There first was a hole in the chair that they gave. I tried to find why there was a hole but didnt push too hard. So I tried to be cautious in case there was a screw or nail causing that hole. I was too tired and wanted to give them the benefit of doubt that it was just aesthetic but unfortunately at that evening, when i was sitting down, my hand automatically landed on the hole and for sure there was a screw. It punctured my palm and the blood didnt stop bleeding for a solid 30minutes (which was the time i tried to squeeze out my blood in the bathroom, took the lift downstairs to get saline wash and bandages and come up to my room again). The manager in charge promised to get back to me on the matter, due to our schedule not able to fit into the next day. But it has been 3 days and nothing.

Imagine if it was a child or another person sitting on that chair. It would have caused a worse injury. I didnt want to make this big but due to your management negligence and incompetence of providing a safe place to stay for your customers, i will have to post this here. Although your team took immediate actions to replace the chair but the damage has been done.

I am not saying this to bad mouth nor defame but it is just very unacceptable and not professional for a hotel of this status providing such DANGEROUS living/resting equipment to your customers. I was not informed enough that I should have just went to ED and get a tetanus shot or even make a report about the safety issue of your place. Now that I have checked out, I doubt your team will even bother for such claims and issues.

The picture shown is only a small dot of blood but that is because i have just wiped it off. The blood did not stop and no i do not have any blood conditions.

No replies, not picking up calls, unsafe environment. I respect confidentiality and will let your management handle the appropriate actions but for your records, my stay was dated 20 September 2025.

I do hope those that are checking out on the reviews will be fully aware that this may happen to you as well. So stay at your own risk.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Everything was good except location of the parking bothers me a bit. Despite that, thumbs up to all. Easy access to ECM (walking distance) and other food stalls.

name: rizal rasidi
text:
My holiday trip from 15/9/25-20/9/25
2nd trip at M Damansara due to demand of work from 17/9-19/9
Stayed at this RCD Hotel. My summary:-
1) room spacious enough, pillow, bed comfortable enough
2) equipment not all working. Had problem with desk phone for both of our rooms
3) cleanliness is good.
4) breakfast spread is good if compared to RCTC but still below RC KL
5) parking is poor. They expect you to pay RM 4 per stay. This is unacceptable.
6) too many kids here, playing at pool and eat free meal during breakfast.
7) the Hotel mgmt should prioritize stay guest then those PRC tourist
8) staff attitude is average. During my 2 days stayed, i observed their staff & mgmt had their breakfast with luxury of time and occupied guest’s space. Our stay at Tres, KL, Mr Yasir is a great example of exellent attitude and attentive

name: Ts. Dr. Roozita Maskun
text:
I recently at Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur to attend the AGM PAUitm 2024, and it was a truly pleasant experience from start to finish. The hotel is beautifully designed, with an elegant lobby and warm ambience that immediately creates a welcoming atmosphere. The location is very strategic, right in the heart of Kuala Lumpur and close to major attractions like KLCC and Pavilion.

The staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, and professional. They made the entire experience smooth and enjoyable, always ready with a smile and prompt assistance. My lounge was spacious, clean, and comfortable, providing a great place to have  meetings.

The event lounge where the AGM was held was cozy, well-organized, and perfect for formal functions. The setting was elegant, with comfortable seating and excellent facilities that made the event run seamlessly. The food served during the event was absolutely delicious, beautifully presented and full of local and international flavours.

Overall, Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur provides the perfect balance of comfort, service, and convenience. It’s an ideal venue for business events, conferences, or a relaxing city stay.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a refined yet welcoming hotel experience in Kuala Lumpur.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: Hot and air conditioning not cold
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: alec ng
text:
Expressing my dissatisfaction regarding the poor service and unacceptable attitude of one of your room attendants during my current stay at Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur, after so many visits here.

I returned to my room, Room 440, at around 5:00 PM, only to find that the room had not yet been made up. I then approached the room attendant’s cleaning cart to request for a bath towel. The attendant, who was not wearing a name tag, responded rudely and unwillingly provided only one towel, stating that I had already received one in the morning. When I asked when my room would be made up, he simply replied “later” in an unfriendly tone.

For your reference, I had turned on the “Do Not Disturb” sign at around 10:50 AM (after returning from breakfast) and switched it to “Make Up Room” at about 1:10 PM. Despite this, my room still remained unserviced by 5:00 PM.

My main concern is twofold:

1. Service Delay: What is the standard operating procedure (SOP) when a guest switches from “Do Not Disturb” to “Make Up Room” in the afternoon, yet the room remains uncleaned for after four hours?

2. Staff Attitude: The rude and dismissive behavior of the room attendant was completely inappropriate and unprofessional. Such conduct is not acceptable, especially in a hotel that prides itself on hospitality.

I have been a regular guest at your hotel and have never complained about room defects (lights, tv, power plugs) or cleanliness (stained linen, unclear rubbish), however, the unpleasant attitude displayed by this room attendant today was disappointing and unacceptable.

I urge the management to review the behavior and suitability of this particular staff member, as such attitude reflects poorly on the reputation of Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur.

Yours,
Dzul
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Nur Izzati Abdullah
text:
Firstly, upon check-in, we was assigned Room 710 (came for company dinner) which I was later informed should not have been sold to guests due to a broken toilet. It was concerning that a room in such condition was still made available, causing unnecessary inconvenience.

Secondly, I found the breakfast selection to be quite limited and not up to the standard I expected from your hotel.

Most concerning was the lack of assistance from the reception staff during check-out. As a pregnant woman, I specifically requested help with carrying my luggage and to safely store it as I was not ready to check out yet. Unfortunately, the two female receptionists on duty were unhelpful and dismissive. I was initially told to carry my bags myself, and only after I walked away did they offer to assist. This lack of empathy and professionalism was very disappointing.

We chose the Royal Hotel expecting a comfortable and welcoming experience, but sadly, this was not the best experienced.

name: Lim Yc
text: I have checked in two rooms for 3 days from 7 to 9 Oct 2025 and cost me about 2 thousands Ringgit Malaysia. I have forgotten to valudate my TnG card when checked out. It cost me additional Riggit Malaysia 54.00. I requested for a refund. The hotel said carpark is under different entity which I was not informed with. The hotel staff said cant help me but asked me to call the carpark management. I called up and was told if I dont validate my TnG card I cant get the refund. To this simple answer, I am deeply disapponited, for if I have validated my card in the first place, why do I need a refund. Ringgit Malaysia 54.00 is not a big deal to me after all I spent 2 thousands for the rooms. But Very Big to the hotel.

name: Trip.com Member
text: The hotel enjoys a great location in the heart of Kuala Lumpur, making it very convenient for exploring the city. While the property is a bit older, it is well maintained and still in good condition, which adds to its charm rather than detracts from it. The classic architectural design complements the slightly aged building, giving it a sense of character and elegance that modern hotels sometimes lack.In terms of experience, the overall stay was pleasant and comfortable. The facilities were clean, and the service was attentive. The food, while adequate, was just average compared to expectations, and could be improved to match the otherwise high standards of the hotel.Overall, Royale Chulan KL offers a memorable stay with character, ideal for those who appreciate a blend of history, comfort, and a central location.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Naren Hassani
text:
Used to stay at this hotel years ago and it always used to be pleasant. After coming back this time I will NEVER return. The room was full of cockroaches, the carpets looked like someone had been murdered there or had relieved themselves.

The water in the bathroom sink and shower tasted like something was wrong. Everytime we turned on the air conditioning it caused us to sneeze during hours.

Also, there was mushrooms growing out of a service door on the 3rd floor. When we told staff all they did was break it and leave the half broken mushrooms in the same place.

This hotel should not be a 5 star hotel, and in all honesty we stayed at 4 star hotels in Malaysia that were 100x better. The lobby looks nice but the rooms arw absolutely horrible.

Very disappointing experience and I would ask that everyone stay as far away as possible. If you stay there more than 3 days you will get sick, guaranteed.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

text:
The lobby is nice and has a fancy feel. There are two lifts for guests, which is convenient. My wing was not connected to the swimming pool and gym, so I didn’t get the chance to visit them. The interior has a classic design but is well maintained. The bed was comfortable, the toilet flush didn't work, I have manually open & flush it evevrytime. I suggest you bring your own toiletries. No bathrobes provided. Hair dryer & clothes iron provided.

The location is great, just within walking distance to Pullman and Pavilion. However, the street outside can feel a little intimidating at night. Overall, the stay was very pleasant.

text: Foods are good. Clean room and good service. Aircond was a bit warm. Rooms are all for non smokers.

name: Ezza Faridha
text:
I checked in here with my husband on Friday and checked out on Sunday. Overall, I was really satisfied with their service. There was no deposit required during check-in, which was a plus. Finding our room was easy, and the deluxe double room was very spacious.

All the facilities mentioned during booking were provided and worked well. The shower and toilet were clean. Extra pillows and slippers were available in the wardrobe, and there was also a safety box to keep valuable items.

The swimming pool is accessible from 4.30 pm to 6.45 pm, and Muslims can swim as long as proper attire is worn. The staff were very kind and helpful in guiding us. Breakfast was served at Level L — for me, it was okay, nothing special.

The only downside was the mattress. It was quite hard, and both my husband and I ended up with backaches and didn’t sleep very well. Other than that, everything was good.

Overall, I’d rate this place 4 out of 5 stars
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: daddydrives
text:
We stayed at Royale Chulan Damansara and booked the Family Suite, which turned out to be perfect for our trip. The suite was exceptionally spacious, with two bedrooms and plenty of room for the children to play and move about comfortably. It was so large that they could literally run in circles, which kept them happily entertained while we relaxed.

The setup made it ideal for a family stay—everyone had their own space, yet we could still enjoy time together in the shared living area. Having two bathrooms also made things so much more convenient, especially during the busy morning routines. The rooms were well-kept, comfortable, and provided everything we needed for a pleasant stay.

The hotel’s location at The Curve is another plus point, with easy access to shopping, dining, and entertainment options just steps away. This made it effortless to head out for meals or pick up things we needed, without worrying about long travel times.

Service from the staff was warm and attentive throughout our stay, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable. Overall, the Family Suite at Royale Chulan Damansara offers great value, comfort, and convenience for families looking for a relaxing and memorable staycation.

Spacious bathroom with bathtub and shower.||Staff were very friendly as well.||Breakfast was good and had a lot of variety. ||The only gripe, guests have to pay parking too albeit at reduced rate. ||Location wise, it’s in the middle of KL but no designated pedestrian walkway to walk to either Pavilion or KLCC. Might be a struggle in the heat although the location is quite near.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: RIE ISWANDI
text: Recommended hotel to stay in KL
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Desmond
text: Room is okay and can't expect much because is an old hotel. Breakfast start at 6.30 but some dish not even ready when I was there at 7. Nasi lemak and curry chicken taste bland. Roti canai is like a piece of rubber. When I asked the bell boy at the main entrance for direction to Pavillion Shopping Mall, he told me just walk straight from hotel main entrance and pointed the mall just across the street whereby pedestrian can't even cross the street. You need to walk much further down the street to use the pedestrian bridge. I later found out there is a shorter route from hotel back entrance to the mall with a proper hotel signage showing the direction when I was walking back. I believe this bell boy purposely showing me the longer route direction. The management need to look into this matter and there is no smile or greetings from the staff too. Only the valet parking guy is friendly.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Kelly Arif
text: Such a poor service! came here for the buffet at Warisan Cafe!! and they said the seafood is limited! They should’ve let us know EARLIER!! Bcs we travelled all the way for their lobster buffet and came with nothing! NONE! My First and the LASTTT! such a scam! poor dining restaurant, the food is soo bad! it’s a scam!
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: VIKENTIIA
text:
-
Отель 5 звёзд по ощущениям оказался придорожным мотелем. В номере загаженный, весь в пятнах, ковёр, многолетняя пыль в шкафу и за тумбами, сломанные абажуры, максимально истёртая мебель, в нескольких ящиках в принципе отсутствовали ручки для выдвижения, так как они просто отвалились ранее, судя по виду. Заявленных халатов не было. Набор для душа - это три микро-бутылочки (шампунь, бальзам и гель), которых с трудом хватит одному человеку на одну помывку. Сантехника вся старая, унитаз древний, гигиенический душ самый дешёвый, старый и распыляющийся во все стороны, а слив расположен на прямом уровне, в итоге вода из туалета не уходит никогда. Завтраки подаются азиатские - шведский стол с выбором китайских и индийских блюд. Классической и/или европейской еды просто нет. Питались булками. Стирка стоит бешеных денег, в других отелях КЛ сильно дешевле. В итоге стирали сами))🤣
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

text: Overall was ok, old hotel facilities but comfortable.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Allson Yong
text:
Stayed for a night there on Saturday. I didn't realize that this was out from the Curve til I got there.

Everything was ok. No major issues, but not the best stay either.

The linens were a little stained, bathroom was clean but very old. I didn't like that toilet was so far from the shower area.

Pool was small.

Service was good but not great. The spa is no longer active even though on the website it says it is. (You'd have to go to Urban Retreat in the Curve, which is a great spa)

Location was superb tho, cos it's a 3 minute walk (would have been even better if the connecting bridge was still usable) from the hotel to the Curve which is then connected to IPC and also Lotus.

Overall good stay. if you just need a clean, comfy bed to sleep and easy access to nearby malls with good food and nice grocers and easy on the wallet, this is it.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Room is spacious with all basic facilities. Bed is comfy. Hotel staff are helpful. Check in process is quite smooth. Location is near to shopping mall and easy to locate. Value for money if have discount. Parking is LPR system but you still need to validate at reception and pay RM 4 per entry. Not convenient for hotel guest that need multiples in and out. Room and facilities are quite old (estimate more than 10 years). Out of three lifts from main lobby to rooms, only one lift is working. Hotel didn't provide towel, only delivered after requested. The link bridge that connected hotel to the mall as well as most of the access already closed, so need to walk quite a distance to the nearby mall (eCurve, IPC, IKEA, The Curve)
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: So far semua ok, dr receptionist smpi check in dan check out hotel pn terbaik. Kemudahan yg lengkap, dengan kedai makan yg dekat, wifi utk guest. Keep it up..
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Anup S
text:
Best place to stay with family and business visit as well.
Best services provided.
Quality breakfast.
Overall best hotel in Kuala Lumpur/Selangor/Petaling Jaya.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Room was clean , breakfast was great too. Location close to The Curve .
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: David
text:
I had a weird experience at the breakfast restaurant. I arrived late that morning and was trying to quickly get the necessary food before the counter closed. An Indian gentleman, who appeared to be supervising the area, tapped me on the shoulder to remind me that the food had to be consumed within the restaurant. I think he made a strong assumption that I intended to take the food away, which was not the case.

He then informed an Indian female staff member, who intermittently monitored me throughout my meal. This created an unpleasant atmosphere, and I felt rushed to finish. As soon as I mentioned that I was done, she immediately cleared the remaining cakes and roti prata from the table. I can only hope that these items were not intended to be reused the next day.

I believe hotel customers should feel warmly cared for, rather than closely monitored. I hope the Management will look into this matter to ensure a more comfortable and respectful dining experience for future guests.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Farah Atika
text: Stay 1 night at this hotel for work. Overall, this place is cozy and comfortable to stay. Placed in the middle of town, easy to find. I have no time to use the facilities provided because I stay for work, but I can say the facilities are good. The foods are delicious and yummy. A lot of choices to choose from. The room is cozy and clean. The staff are polite and friendly. Just a little off because the ballroom is next to another ballroom and it is not sound proof. So it is quite noisy when the next ballroom is occupied with other people with loud sound.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

He is aware but choose not to entertain because probably we look penniless as we were just wandering at the lobby and just try to buy the 50% discounted pastry 😌 instead immediately attended the new costumer who just came in and take their order right away. I would not forget this experience. We were just try to enjoy the view and wander around. No issue to spend my money even if its full price I still will buy it for my kids if they wanted to.

text: Very comfortable bed and pillow, aircon freezing cold, high quality toiletries, 2 big tables for work.Room service team notice both water bottles are consumed, they put 4 bottles for me, an initiative that much appreciated, they saw me using disposable slipper, gave 2 thicker and high quality disposable slippers, but not every room service team will do this consistently.the cloth hanger cord is broken, TV a bit too small to watch on bed.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: Excellent
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: wingster1
text: Forgot to check the reviews when i booked this for a business trip.  The hotel is a bit dated as the reviews state and a make over is needed to be called a 5 star hotel.  Based on the 4 star i stayed in Singapore before, this would be closer to a 3.5 star hotel.|| Not all is bad. I had a massive room on the 6th floor which was nice.  Hot water fine, clean, no smells.  The only part of the room that was not 5 star was the wear and tear on furniture, small amounts of mold in the show grout and the air conditioning unit that was old and a bit noisy.  Safe was there, ironing board and water bottles always topped up.  Not sure why house keeping trying to do room before 9am?||The rest of the hotel was fine. Decor dated but clean. Pool looked fine and small gym. Breakfast was fine.  The was a mix of offering from continental to indian, Chinese and local.  Good chance to experience other foods from around asia for those embracing the experience.||Location was excellent as only a short walk to the main shopping area.  There are building works right next to the hotel now and while my room was the opposite side, if located near the building site area i can understand the issues.  This building impacts on other hotels there too. There are two ugly tall  buildings incomplete from covid the other side, next to the Pullman and Banyan hotel. One assumes you are out and about seeing things so it should not affect a tourist stay.||There must be some cheaper rooms as many of the guests staying are not what you would expect at a 5 or 4 star hotel.||THEY DO NOT SERVE ALCOHOL IN THE HOTEL.  Not sure how you can be 5 star and remove the option from customers?   This is their choice and reflects the main customers they have and I had no issue.  Respect the culture of the country you are in.  Plenty of bars around outside so not an issue unless an alcoholic.||Staff very friendly as expected.  I had a good stay and enjoyed it especially as so cheap.  This is the thing to consider, other 5 star hotels will be 2 to 3 times more expensive.  For the price, this hotel worked well. £70 per night plus tax in 2025!  Manage your expectations when that cheap.  Needs modernisation to get 5 star.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: Overall satisfied. Weekend busy time plan early for the breakfast buffet, otherwise some foods will finish around 9.30am.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Jhaye Lynn
text: Its nice hotel .. old as u can tell from the smell specially in the hallways ..navigation in the hotel is quite confusing ... also whats WEIRD ?? Their staff has to video tape everything they do .. like literrally everything ...!!!
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: 조민우
text:
3박 4일 예약 (프리미어 트윈룸 예약했지만 실제로 묵지 못함)

룸 : 금연방에도 담배 냄새 / 창틀에 담뱃재 / 큰 에어컨 소음(온도 조절 안됨) / 방음이 안 좋아 옆방 대화소리가 생생하게 들림
조식 : 많은 사람들이 집게를 안 쓰고 손으로 음식을 집어가지만 직원들 제지 없음 / 직원들도 손으로 음식 채워 넣음 / 뜬금없이 직원들끼리 일하는 모습 서로 찍어주는데 바쁨.
수영장 : 수영장 샤워기 수압 약함 / 수영장 화장실에서 직원들 담배 피우고 있음 (수영장 전체 금연임)

** 11층 룸에서 녹물 나옴.
오전 10시부터 고쳐달라 요청해도 데스크 직원들 별 신경 안 씀.
(수영장 가서 양치질 및 샤워하라고 함)
계속된 요청에 낮 12시에 수도 엔지니어 방으로 옴.
(조명 때문에 물이 노랗게 보이는 거라고 함)
여자 중년 매니저도 곧이어 방으로 옴.
- 녹물 해결 못할 것 같다고 방 변경 제안 (거절 후 환불 요구)
- 숙박하지 않은 1박의 숙박비 환불해 주겠다고 함.
( 아고다 통해 예약했으니 아고다로 환불 요청을 하라고 함)
- 다른 호텔로 교통수단 제공받음.
(어떤 일로 호텔 옮기는지 뻔히 알면서 다른 호텔 앞에서 v 포즈로 사진 찍으라는 운전사)

귀국 후 현재까지 아고다 통해 환불 요청했지만 수차례 거절됨. (아고다 고객센터 측에서는 호텔에서 거절한다고 알려줌)
호텔에 항의 메일 보내니 알아보고 답변 준다는 답장 받은 지 9일째 되는 날에도 여전히 연락 없음.

*** 시설이 낡은 건 이해하겠지만 게으르고 무책임한 호텔 직원들 때문에 절대 비추하는 호텔 ***
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: Good👍🏻 , getting free upgrades 👍🏻 very nice
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: S TEKFA
text:
Nous avons séjourné une après-midi au Chulan Royal Kuala Lumpur en attendant notre vol.

✅ Les points positifs :

L’hôtel est très spacieux, presque comme un palace.

Le staff est souriant, serviable et chaleureux.

À l’occasion de la fête de l’indépendance, on nous a offert un délicieux thé tarik, une belle attention.

Les chambres sont propres et le style général est élégant.

❌ À améliorer :

Je n’apprécie pas personnellement la moquette.

Certaines fournitures en bois et équipements de salle de bain mériteraient un rafraîchissement ou une rénovation.

Les portes ne se ferment pas automatiquement, il faut penser à vérifier derrière soi, et certaines semblent un peu datées.

👉 En résumé : un bel hôtel spacieux avec un service attentionné et une ambiance élégante, mais qui aurait besoin de quelques rénovations pour être parfait.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member

text: ツインルームに宿泊しました。ホテルは古いようで、客室のドアを最後まで引いて閉めないと開いたままでした。また、寝室とバスルームやトイレとの間に扉ありましたが、とても硬くて閉まりませんでした。朝食は開始時間でも、用意のできていないメニューも多く、のんびりした感じでした。フォーの食材のトマトにカビが生えてたのには驚きました。カレー、パンなどは美味しかったです。

name: Trip.com Member
text: good value for money, can walk to KLCC and pavillion
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Mui Fong Lai
text: We came for a Summit as a group of 20+ the past week. The room is spacious and quite clean, except for signs of water leakage and mould, which most hotels have problems cleaning off for some reason, not that it's a difficult thing to do. The wifi is good and the pool perimeters can be cleaned up (mould again). Breakfast buffet was just OK tho' the spread is good enough. Minori Japanese restaurant was not bad as well Coffee Dream serves good coffee and snacks. It's not far from The Curve, just around the corner, so very suitable for shopping lovers.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Great location and no issue with cleanliness of the 3 rooms I booked for my family.Staff was accommodating to our requests for late check-out and purchase of additional bed in one of our rooms. However, there was poor communication among the staff either in reception and/or housekeeping.1. Late check-out till 2pm was granted to 1 room while the other 2 rooms till 1pm after we made a call to the hotel. When the access cards were sent for validation, was told all 3 rooms extended till 1pm only. Beyond that, subject to extra charges. Was told no record in the system that there is prior approval for the special extension for one of the room. Nonetheless, this exception was still granted but only after we made another call to the hotel.2. Payment for extra bed has to be made first before the bed can be set up. This was fine. Paid before we left the hotel for the day. However, after we returned to hotel at night expecting the extra bed ready for us, were disappointed to find no extra bed. Apparently it was sent to the wrong room despite having specified which room it was to be sent to. Payment for extra bed was to come with extra towel and toiletries for the third person but these were not provided despite the earlier assurances that it would.3. Low marks for amenities - old hotel and the rooms assigned to us really do need refurbishment! Pretty run down condition. Overall, still a pleasant stay due to its convenient location.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Bill chuah
text: 房间非常好，地点很靠近mall
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: We booked this hotel for our 3D2N KL trip with the kids. The location was strategic — we headed to Gamuda Fun Park around 5:30pm on Thursday and the traffic was smooth. It’s also just 5 minutes from IKEA and KidZania, which was super convenient for us.That said, the hotel room felt a bit dated, so don’t expect too much. But as long as it feels safe, I’m okay with it.

The food are cold, even at 7.00am (breakfast starts 630am). Some of the food tasted funky (like almost rotten), watermelon & braised peanuts. So, it's a big NO NO for me. Options / varieties are adequate.

name: Ts. Dr. Yuseni bin Ab Wahab
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Despite having rooms available, reception insists on 3pm check in. A lot has been said about such silly policy as whether you get in at 12 or at 3. The hotel still has to provide due service per stay. You don’t get a discount when you check out early do you?Room was missing hand and face towel. Didn’t think much of it till I clarified upon check out. While I could have called down, it is basic checklist that all amenities including towels and more are provided. Why does a guest need to call down for service that is due? You won’t expect to go and collect your food for in room dining would you? Cleanliness is decent. Though the facility does need some refurbishment as things are starting to rot and peel. There is also a lingering stagnant smell in the air. Hotel is located walking distance to the mall and IKEA. An MRT station is also not a far walk away.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Rooms are big but very old school. Clean but the rooms have visible marks of wear and tear. Gym and pool open and close at 7pm - 8pm. Unlike the hotels nowadays, that operates 24 hour amenities.TV uses antenna and you will get a blurry/static picture like in the olden days.

title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: The price was quite reasonable for the room and location. However, this is marketed as a 5 star hotel, and it definitely is not up to par for a 5 star hotel in KL--I would consider it more like a 3.5 star hotel level. When checking in, they tried to double-charge me the tourist tax, and I had to prove to them that it was already collected by the booking site. Then, I got to my room and found that the soap and shampoo were totally empty, and the safe was not working (replace battery error), and there was some rubbish still in the room. I called and waited for them to come address these issues, and saw that the "premium herbal" soap and shampoo in the shower was refilled by a worker carrying used water bottles filled with generic soap and shampoo. Again, I don't really mind too much except that it felt like the 5 star label was very fake, and this was a 3.5 star hotel trying to hope nobody notices these things. But, the price indeed was a 3 or 4 star price, so I don't feel ripped off--just misled. Rooftop infinity pool had a nice view, and fitness centre was outdated with some broken equipment--but sufficed. I would stay again for a business trip in the area, but would set my expectations accordingly.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: STEK TAN
text:
Around the world, there are many old 5 star hotels that, despite it's age, retains it's beauty, charm, cleanliness and service excellence. This hotel is NOT one of them. First time staying here and the moment I stepped into the cold and uninviting lobby, I knew I was going to be disappointed. Waited a while for the receptionist to sort out my booking even though I had pre ordered and pre paid. No welcome drink for a 5 stars and I waited with flies buzzing around you in the lobby.

The lifts, the walkways were old, dirty and dusty and you can see many cracks along the wall panelling. The room, while neat, was extremely dusty and dirty, due to overusage and time. The carpet, especially at the edge of the room, was thick with dust and the toilet looks like a public toilet. Bed was really old with no top layer and not really comfortable.

Breakfast was decent though with good selection. In the evening, I went to the smoking bar and it was empty with no staff to service. Overall while the hotel is huge, the deco is cold and uninviting. They desperately need a renovation and frankly they should be downgraded to a 4 or 3 stars. Thankfully, their prices already reflect that.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

text: The hotel is nice with great location. Walking distance to the curve, ipc and ikea. They also have Chulan Corner if you want to chill at night with their goreng-goreng food + western with affordable price. The downside is the check in is after 3pm and some cars were not validated for parking. Youre supposed to be charged at RM4 flat rate but turned out to be charged at RM25+. title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Siti Noor Raodhah Ibrahim
text: Very disappointing stay. The air conditioner in our room wasn't working, and the room was extremely hot. Despite raising the issue, the staff didn’t offer to change our room or provide any solution. On top of that, the water from the tap was dirty and yellow in color—completely unacceptable. Would not recommend.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: M A
text:
Stayed here in Aug 2025 with family and enjoyed our stay.
Staff were very friendly and helpful from check in to check out. One of the rooms we were initially given had a terrible smell to it (we guessed it was water from the carpet near the bathroom) and the staff were nice enough to upgrade us to better rooms on the 7th floor that had wooden floors and balconies.
The location of the hotel is perfect, easy walk to Pavilion mall and other places.
Only negative for me was the breakfast - the choices, though it seemed a lot just didn't cater to the majority and quality of food i thought was below par. So much so i didn't bother going after day 2 of our 7 day stay there even though I'd paid for it.
I recommend this hotel as rooms are big and spacious, with good swimming etc as long as you don't mind that it's a bit old and can do with modernising overall but it's well maintained.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: 設施有點舊，服務尚好，酒店充滿馬來風情，早餐，點餐都好吃，交通方便，去景點Grab價格便宜，整個感覺不錯

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: I recently stayed at this hotel and had a generally pleasant experience, though there are some areas for improvement. The room I stayed in was spacious and clean, which I appreciated. However, the furniture felt a bit outdated. It seems the hotel has made some refurbishments—such as fresh paint on the walls—but a more complete upgrade would enhance the overall comfort and appeal.The water pressure in the bathroom was excellent, but I found the amenities quite basic—only two bath towels were provided, with no face towels, which was a little disappointing.One of the main reasons I booked this hotel was for the kids’ club, but unfortunately, it was closed during my visit without any prior notice. Additionally, the pool area appeared to be undergoing some upgrading works; I noticed some parts of the flooring had been removed. While it’s good to see maintenance being done, there were also a few dead insects in the pool, which raised some concerns about hygiene.A final point worth noting is the change in accessibility to nearby malls. The hotel used to have a direct link bridge to the shopping mall, but now the bridge from the first floor connects only to the Mutiara Damansara MRT station. Guests now have to walk about 350 meters via a sheltered path beside the road to reach IPC Mall, according to Google Maps.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: M Azmi
text:
“Royale Chulan Damansara — Royal Name, Regal Breakfast, Slightly Exposed Feeling @ Rm200/night"

Checked in for a short stay at Royale Chulan Damansara, and here's my quick (but royal) breakdown:

Parking:
Let’s start with the obvious — plenty of parking, so that’s a win. But before you get too excited, you’ll need to pay for it. I think it’s RM3 per exit? Not a dealbreaker, but also not exactly a warm welcome gift. Could’ve at least thrown in a “welcome mint” or something.

The Room:
The rooms? Big. Spacious. I got a king bed and it felt like sleeping on a badminton court — huge.
Classic furniture and finishing, a bit of old-school luxury charm. Honestly, it works… until you realise the toilet has a window. Yes. A window. Between the toilet and the bed. So, if you’re staying with a friend — prepare for eye contact you’ll never unsee. Be ready for that peep, when you poop. You can use blinds though, which still allows 5% exposition.
On the bright side, the shower and toilet are in separate cubicles, with a big sink and mirror area in the middle.
Layout: weirdly functional.

The Vibe:
Corridors are long. Like, marathon-long. First-timers might feel like they’ve entered a maze built by an interior designer who once got lost in IKEA. The whole place has a classic, slightly dated style. My two sen: maybe do a few modern floors, see if guests go for them. Royale Chulan 2.0, anyone?

The Highlight (Seriously): BREAKFAST.
It’s the main event. Huge spread, local to Western, and it’s everywhere. This isn’t your sad buffet with 3 trays and half a toaster — this is a full-on food fiesta. If you're booking, get the breakfast. If you skip it, I don’t know how to help you. You’ll just watch other guests waddle out with teh tarik and regret.

Other Things People Seem to Like:
The mall next door (The Curve) — convenient for shopping or grabbing extras.
Ice skating rink nearby (if you're into falling gracefully).
Friendly staff, with that polished hotel service feel.

Often used for conferences, so business travellers seem to dig it.

Verdict:
If you're into classic hotels with generous space and top-tier breakfast, this place is solid. Just maybe avoid sharing a room unless you're very close — or into open-concept pooping. Your call.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara
