name: Mubarak Shaikh
text:
Hotel is good but reason of 1 star

Room service guy tried to enter room with master key at 12:30 AM.

He ring bell twice and directly used master key to open the door.

Luckily I was awake and certainly angry on him.

He told me that someone from his team Informed that my room was a vacant room and he came to verify.

Security person called on phone, apologized and told not to escalate this matter as he will ask Hotel  Manager to provide apologize letter next morning.

Till I checkout on 11 AM no apology from anyone. Even help desk who helped to checkout I feel not aware what had happened.

This is really dangerous and risky incident happened as people can easily enter room via master key without any manager.

Booking Details.
Check In : 11 Aug
Check out : 12 Aug
Room No : 341
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Erwin Hardy
text:
Royale Chulan KL (11-13th Aug 2025)

When I paid RM 360++ per night, I expected imperfections and was more than willing to make some concessions due to the lower price compared to other 5 star hotels around the vicinity. But what I experienced was way WORSE than I had imagined.
The bathroom was full of black mold around the shower head, corners, bath tub and even the tissue box. Seemed like it had been years since it was last cleaned properly.
Everything looked nasty & disgusting. The squeaky doors, soap marked glasses, torn sofa, stained linens, low water pressure, the list goes on and on. I’m amazed they somehow passed their safety checks despite being an obvious health hazard to the guests.

Service? Almost non existent. We checked in at around 10PM. No one welcomed us at the front doors, no such thing as a welcome drink, no music, no baggage handlers, NOTHING! Even the counter was empty and we had to wait for a few minutes for someone to check us in. Hilarious…
I strongly suggest would be visitors to opt for other nearby establishments and avoid this total embarrassment of a so call 5 star hotel.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

Jedzenie bardzo urozmaicone i duży wybór. Smaczne i aromatyczne, uwaga: często pikantne. Basen czysty, mało ludzi na basenie, może 6 osób było.  Polecam.

name: Frakc Kiteklate
text:
Je voyage avec mes enfants et on a passé deux nuits dans cet hôtel qui ne devrait pas avoir les étoiles annonces. Outre le fait que certains équipements commencent a dater il m est arrivé quelque chose d inacceptable qui aurait donné lieu a des excuses un remboursement et un surclassement dans n'importe quel autre hôtel digne de ce nom! La lampe de chevet ne s allumait pas, jusque là on se dit juste que les chambres ne sont pas inspectés comme il se doit, mais en voulant vérifier s il ne s agissait que du serrage de l ampoule, la douille m est restée dans les mains et les fils électriques a nus .
Je ne vais pas dans un soi disant 5 étoiles pour me faire électrocuter et mes enfants non plus.
La réaction de l hôtel n a été que de réparer la lampe avec du chatterton, une honte.
Pas de geste commercial, les étoiles ça se mérite et là elles ne sont pas méritées.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Miz Nana
text:
Absolutely disappointed with this so-called 4-star hotel. I woke up in the middle of the night to find a cockroach crawling under my blanket, which is completely unacceptable for any hotel, let alone one that claims to be 4-star quality. On top of that, the tap water was yellowish, which made me question their hygiene standards.

I made a complaint before check-out time and requested compensation for the unpleasant experience, but the response was totally unacceptable. The Duty Manager, Hakimi, offered a “room upgrade” for my next stay — as if I would ever want to return after this horrible experience. Even worse, they expected me to pay for another room in order to “compensate” me.

In addition, the room I booked was not a regular room — it was an Executive Suite, which cost me extra, yet the condition and service were far below expectations.

The Assistant Manager, Farahida Faric, refused to contact me on the same day to address the issue, showing a complete lack of professionalism and urgency.

This hotel is not worth your money or peace of mind. Poor hygiene, poor management, and zero accountability. Definitely not a 4-star experience — more like no-star service

name: JF
text:
I had a pleasant 2-night stay overall. The hotel staff were friendly, and both breakfast and lunch offered a great selection of tasty and varied dishes — definitely a highlight of the stay.

A special mention to Mr. Nuh, the engineering technician, who was polite, patient, and genuinely helpful when I had an issue with the in-room hair dryer. His service really made a difference.

That said, the room furniture is quite run-down and clearly hasn’t been refurbished in a long time. An upgrade would certainly enhance the overall comfort and appeal of the stay.

For RM550 for 2 nights (including 2 breakfasts per day), it’s absolutely a good value for a 4-star hotel. Just hoping the rooms will get an upgrade soon.

name: Asian Buildmart

title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: sora yu
text:
디럭스 킹(킹 사이즈 침대)
1. 말레이 전통 양식을 이용한 호텔.
2. 오래되어 클래식한 분위기 느끼고 싶으면 좋음.(엔틱 가구들이 세월의 흔적이 느껴짐)
3. 침대가 크고 편안함.
4. 테라스가 있음.
5. 넓은 수영장이 있음.(애들 있으면 테라스가 수영장과 연결된 방에 묵음 괜찮음)
6. 시내라 교통 좋음.
Conlay Mrt역 게이트 B가 호텔 바로 앞에 있음. 구글맵에서 게이트 A알려주는데 B가 바로 앞에 있음.
공항에서 klia transit 타고 putrajaya 역에서 MRT로 환승 Conlay Mrt역에서 하차.  (토탈 MRT 4.3+ klia transit 9.4링깃)

파빌리온 몰까지 걸어서 감. (호텔 나와서 반얀 트리 호텔로 들어가 엘베 타고 올라가면 파빌리온 몰까지 가는 연결 통로 나옴.)
7. 정말 조용함. 세상 조용함.. (에어컨 소리가 좀 남. 줄이고 자면 괜춘)
8. 조식에 중식, 말레이식, 인디아식. 서양식 다 있음. 단, 이슬람 특화 음식(할랄 음식)이라 돼지 고기 요리는 없음.
(식당에서 일하는 직원들 잘해줘서 고마워요.특히 커피 코너 Wasim 씨 친절함에 감사,)
9. 화장실이 넓고 변기와 샤워실 분리. 욕조가 따로 있음.  특이하게 방과 욕실이 큰 창문으로도 연결됨. (모르는 사람과 가면 좀 난감. 가족끼리는 오케이)
10. 욕실용 드라이기 있음. 다리미 있음.
11. 에어컨 리모컨이 없고 현관문에 가서 조절 가능.
12. 방 불이 노란 불밖에 없어서 어두움.
13. 한국인 거의 없음.
14. 늦은 체크아웃 5시까지 하면 150링깃 내야 함. (그래도 공항 캡슐 호텔 한 명 가격임.)
15. 호텔 로비 공용 여자 화장실은 셋 중 하나만 사용 가능. 그것도 청소 안 해 놓음... 로비 화장실을 5성급에서.. 가장 이해 불가.
16. 하루 관광세 10링깃.
17. 스마트 TV아님.

18.늘 쿠알라룸푸르 와서 느끼는 거지만  이 도시는 비즈니스 여행 오는 곳이지 가족 여행 오는 곳은 아님. 다른 동남아 호텔 가서 호캉스하시길....
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Anonymous 8055
text: Other than location everything was not good. Waiter/waitress x sepatutnya foreigner. Nak communicate mintak sesuatu susah bile xpaham Bahasa Melayu.

name: Eric Tan
text:
The location is perfect, with attractions nearby and within easy walking distance, making it incredibly convenient.
The hotel boasts a Malay palace-style design, comfortable ambiance, and friendly service. It's definitely worth a return visit.
The only issue was the room lighting was a little dim, perhaps due to personal preference, but everything else was excellent.

전체적인 시설과 Room Condition 매우 좋습니다.
2일간 잘 즐기면서 지낼 수 있을 것 같습니다.

name: tan seng hou
text:
It was my first time staying at Royale Chulan and I would expect it to be up to a standard since it is a well established hotel.

After I entered the room, the room was warm so I went to turned on the aircond and turned it to 16 degrees. However after awhile around 30 mins or so, the room was still warm and not really cool, I tried to turned it on and off again, switched the fan speed but to no avail.

Hence, I tried living it on and I went for a few hours and it was still not cooling at all and finally I tried to turn the temperature to around 30 then only the room was cooling enough.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Mohd Anuar Amari

title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Yee Suen Le
text:
Coming for the tea time snack .
Welcome by hospitality staff .
Service consider ok . Food variety not many choices for high tea. We ordered mushroom soup which is nice but sardine puff need some improvement .
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Vivian Chua
text:
I think this might be the best hotel in the heart of Seremban. It is very close to so many shops and restaurants. You will avoid traffic as compared to if you stay in Seremban 2.
It is an old hotel, hence some parts of the rooms are outdated and the sofa chair can be replaced. However, the rooms, the hallways, elevator, lobby, all areas are neat and clean. Parking is easy and free for hotel room guests. The reception will ask for your car number plate at check-in and you can enter and exit carpark anytime and however many times you want. Before entering the carpark, the automated sensor will detect your number plate before allowing you to enter. The carpark is new, clean and felt very safe. There is also a 24-hour convenience store near the reception in the lobby that is self check-out.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Xul Xohari
text:
Bilik selesa

Only disappointment was the breakfast - think it could have been much better but overall it was a very comfortable stay.

name: Trip.com Member
text: I had an excellent stay at this hotel. The staff were warm, professional, and always willing to help, making me feel very welcome from the moment I arrived. The room was spotless, spacious, and well-designed, with all the amenities I needed for a comfortable stay.The location was perfect—close to key attractions, shops, and public transport, yet quiet enough to enjoy a good night’s rest. I especially appreciated the thoughtful details, such as the high-quality bedding, complimentary toiletries, and smooth check-in process.Breakfast was delicious with a wide variety of options, and the facilities, including the gym and lounge, were well maintained. Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations and offered excellent value for money.I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area and look forward to staying again.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

text: Very very slow registration... only can register after 3. But have to check out by 12.. 3.20 and still waiting in line. Very Very poor. Room is old peeling paint. Tiny tv which is blurry.  Counter staff with tidak apa attitude. The plus point is the location and the room is bigger than most.

name: Mr Subzero
text:
Guest Feedback – Royale Chulan Damansara

During my recent stay at Royale Chulan Damansara, I was truly touched by the warm hospitality I received—especially from Bazmeer at the lobby. When I needed assistance from the manager, Bazmeer greeted me with such kindness and genuine care, speaking to me as if I were a member of his own family. His warmth and professionalism instantly made me feel at ease.

Not only did he listen attentively, but he also resolved my issue quickly and efficiently, going above and beyond what I expected. I left the lobby feeling deeply satisfied, truly blessed by the experience, and with heartfelt appreciation for his exceptional service.

It’s rare to come across someone who brings such sincerity to their role. Thank you, Bazmeer. I would love to return to Royale Chulan Damansara, knowing there are people like you who make every guest feel so valued.

With gratitude and love,
Sarawakian love ❤️
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: The hotel is our preferred property for our guests at our choral academy in TTDI. Just 10 minutes away, our guests love the big, comfortable rooms, easily accessible to nearly malls and also via MRT to 1 Utama & KL City Centre. The breakfast provided is also good. Great value for money.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Location is strategic as it is near Curve and there are many restaurants, cafes, shops and IKEA within 10 minutes walking distance.Checking in and out was smooth with friendly staff. Room was large, clean, air conditioning good, water pressure strong and bed was comfortable.Parking is fixed at RM4 daily with unlimited exits. Nice place to stay if you are around Mutiara Damansara.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Esha Murthy
text:
My family and I stayed for 4days and loved the service by the F&B team.. great hospitality provided by everyone.. everyone were so respectful and the hotel was very neat and hygienic..
Also the food was great.. i would love to visit again
Also the hotel is in a very peaceful surrounding.. with a mall in walkable distance so it's very convenient..
Overall I loved the stay
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: We booked two rooms, but only one was ready when we arrived. The second room was only available around 4:55 PM, which was quite a long wait considering we checked in at about 3:30 PM. Thankfully, the hotel allowed us a slightly late check-out to make up for the delay.The Qibla direction inside the room was confusing. Fortunately, we had adjacent rooms and noticed the Qibla markings were inconsistent. It’s best to double-check using a Qibla app to ensure accuracy.We were excited to try the buffet breakfast after reading many positive reviews. However, the food was just average in our opinion. The sambal for the nasi lemak lacked flavor and didn’t taste like the typical Malaysian version which is something international guests might be looking forward to. Cantoneese noodle, ommelete and tosai superb. Overall, it was a decent stay. The staff were friendly and helpful.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: It meet beyond our expectation, tq.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member

name: nur syuhadah
text:
Room was okay and spacious but it is in old design.I get mite bites from the bed.
Plus we are supposed to get free breakfast for 2 on our 2nd day of stay but were denied at the restaurant entrance.then husband paid rm 47 for another pax.
When asked for clarification to the receptionist, they said it is for 2 pax and they are wronged while key in number of pax for breakfast.
Should be royale chulan compensate us with another offer as the paid price cannot be refund.
Their silly mistake cost us to paid the breakfast buffet when it is suppose to be free.
So unfair!
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: One of the best hotels in Seremban. Great location and property was well maintained. Highly recommended
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Ben Johari
text:
The hotel has a classic, slightly old-school vibe, but it’s clean and well-kept, which made me feel comfortable right away. Check-in was smooth, and the staff were friendly and helpful – they made everything feel easy after a long day.

The room was spacious and cozy, with all the basics I needed for a comfortable stay. The bed was super comfy, and I slept really well since the whole place was nice and quiet. The décor leans a bit traditional, but it added to the charm, and I loved that my room overlooked some greenery – it gave a nice relaxing feel even though I was in town. Plenty parking spaces available with LPR entry and exit.

Breakfast the next morning was definitely a highlight. The buffet had a good mix of local Malaysian dishes and Western choices, and everything I tried tasted fresh. I really enjoyed the pastries and made-to-order omelette . The dining area was bright and welcoming, so it was a great start to the day.

Overall, Royale Chulan Seremban felt like a solid choice for a short getaway. It’s not a brand-new, trendy hotel, but it’s comfortable, peaceful, and has great service. For the price, I’d say it’s definitely worth it, and I’d happily come back for another stay if I’m in Seremban again.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Zuhaimi Mustaffa
text: Very good service and food
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: Good placeTo stay when no water
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: Overall okay. Reasonable price. tilam dia  rasa nya tak tukar bed sheet dah lama. 2 malam badan kena gatal2.. bangun pagi je byk merah2.. whole family kena juga ya. Bukan sy sorg. Petang tu nak pegi swim. Minta house keeping bersih kan bilik.. bangla ni bole kata dia turun pg makan dulu nanti naik sy buat. Masa tu dia tgh cleaning bilik depan i ,my room was (0827). Kami balik dr swimming 1jam30 minit kat pool, balik je  bilik ingat dah settle. Tidak ya! Lepas lagi sejam kemudian dia baru dtg nak cleaning. My kids tgh tido penat swim. name: Trip.com Member
text: My partner and I recently enjoyed a staycation at Royal Chulan Hotel Damansara, and it exceeded all our expectations. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality and a sense of calm that immediately set the tone for a relaxing escape.The ambience of the hotel is elegant yet cozy perfect for couples looking to unwind. Our room was spacious, clean, and tastefully decorated with modern touches and traditional Malaysian charm. The bed was incredibly comfortable except for the pillows not very comfortable can  and we especially loved the large windows offering beautiful views of the Damansara skyline.One small area for improvement would be the pillows and bes linen they seemed quite old and could definitely benefit from an upgrade to match the overall comfort of the room. It wasn’t a major issue, but fresher pillows and bed linen would really elevate the sleeping experience.What truly made our stay memorable was the attention to detail and thoughtful service. The staff were always courteous, helpful, and made us feel well taken care of throughout our stay.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Rooms were smelly and old. No safety lock. A little unsafe for female solo traveller. Breakfast is alright, service is so so.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: K T
text:
My recent stay at Royale Chulan Damansara was nothing short of a nightmare. From the moment I arrived, I was met with poor service, outdated facilities, and a complete lack of attention to detail.

**1. Rude and Unprofessional Staff**
The front desk staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. Check-in took forever, and they acted like they were doing me a favor by letting me stay. Requests for basic amenities were met with blank stares or delayed responses.

**2. Dirty and Run-Down Rooms**
The room was supposed to be a "luxury" stay, but it was far from it. Stained carpets, dusty furniture, and a musty smell made it feel more like a budget motel than a 4-star hotel. The bathroom had mold in the corners, and the towels had an odd, unpleasant odor.

**3. Broken Amenities & Poor Maintenance**
The air conditioning barely worked, leaving the room uncomfortably warm. The Wi-Fi was slow and kept disconnecting. Even the TV had issues—half the channels didn’t work, and the remote was faulty.

**4. Overpriced for Terrible Quality**
For the price they charge, I expected so much better. The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best, with limited options and stale pastries. Room service was slow, and the food arrived cold.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: 服务热情，性价比高

name: Trip.com Member
text: I had an extremely disappointing stay at Royale Chulan Damansara. The hygiene standards were unacceptable from the moment I entered the room. The bedsheets were visibly dirty, with strands of hair left on the linens, clearly not changed or cleaned thoroughly. To make matters worse, the cups provided had stains—which is shocking for a hotel that positions itself as a premium stay.The shower area was poorly designed and leaked so badly that the entire toilet floor was flooded, making it unsafe and uncomfortable to use. The air-conditioning was non-functional, and despite calling the front desk five times, no technician came to address the issue. It was frustrating and unacceptable, especially given the hot, humid weather.To top it off, I had arranged for an airport pickup service through the hotel, which never showed up, and no one even followed up. This speaks volumes about the lack of coordination and professionalism in the hotel’s management.This stay was a complete letdown. I expected basic cleanliness and functioning amenities, but was met with negligence and apathy. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone until significant improvements are made in both cleanliness and customer service.

name: rakesh sharma
text:
I checked into Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur around 10:40pm last night, expecting the usual standard of excellence I’ve come to trust from this brand. I’ve stayed at Royale Chulan in Seremban, Damansara, Penang, and even London; all of which have consistently delivered a wonderful experience.

This is not my first time staying at Royale Chulan KL; in fact, it has always been my go-to hotel whenever I am in Kuala Lumpur. Unfortunately, this time was extremely disappointing and unhygienic, unlike anything I’ve experienced at any Royale Chulan property before:

1. My Shirt Got Ruined by a Dirty Iron
The iron in the room left yellow stains on my shirt, rendering it unwearable. It’s clear the iron hasn’t been cleaned or maintained properly.

2. Stained and Unclean Toilet Seat
The toilet seat was visibly dirty and had black marks. This is unacceptable and unhygienic, and should have been cleaned thoroughly before guest check-in.

3. Used-Looking Towel with Yellowish Stain
One of the towels provided had yellowish discoloration on it. I noticed it only after using it and it honestly grossed me out.

4. Empty Tea & Coffee Tray
A basic amenity like a tea/coffee tray was completely empty: no tea, coffee or sugar. This is a bare minimum that even budget hotels get right.

5. Filthy Bathroom Floor Towel
The floor towel had blue and grey stains, looking like it hadn’t been replaced or washed properly.

6. Unsanitary Toilet Floor
There was a repulsive stain on the toilet floor, which had clearly not been cleaned before my arrival. Totally unacceptable.

7. Dead Insect on the Floor
I even found a dead insect on the room floor, which points to poor pest control and a lack of basic cleanliness.

8. Leaking Shower Head & Poor Water Pressure
The shower head was leaking badly, causing water to splurt in multiple directions and significantly reducing the water pressure. Taking a shower was frustrating and inefficient.

I brought this to the attention of Karthik at reception during check-out. Instead of showing concern or offering even a basic apology, he told me to “leave a review on Google.” So here it is.

I’ve always been a loyal guest of Royale Chulan and had great experiences at all other branches, but this KL location severely fell short. I sincerely hope that management takes these issues seriously and addresses the obvious lapses in cleanliness, housekeeping, and customer service.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Dhivya Raj
text:
This hotel used to be good in the past. Lately the standard seems to have dropped.

Issues we faced:
1. The room:
We stayed in room number 510. The shower hose was spraying water in every direction from a malfunctioning connection, causing the whole bathroom to be wet and slippery.
2. Covers of the bathroom fittings (towel hanger, floor trap for tub) were loose and kept falling off. Even the towel hanger behind d door had fallen off with visible holes.
3. Toilet bowl started malfunctioning on the 2nd night and ended up becoming fully clogged by the 3rd day. Poo could not be flushed in and caused the whole room to stink up.
4. Bed creaked every time you move on it. It was so bloody noise and we literally slept without turning for fear of the noise waking our baby daughter.

The restaurant:
1. Went for dinner - ordered a lamb chop well done a fried rice with egg well done and a hot milo. Had to repeat the order almost 3x.
In the end i was given an ice chocolate. Only after making noise it was changed to a hot chocolate. Lamb came raw and when we tried to explain it to the waitress she brought the chef out who told us he is not well versed in cooking western food. Why do you have it on the menu if u cannot provide it?
The egg that was asked to be welldone came out bullseye and had to be sent back. And the dishes were tasteless - totally not worth the price.

Swimming pool:
Green water and so poorly maintained.

All in all, I wouldnt recommend this hotel and I would suggest choosing other resorts instead!

name: Mahar Mahar
text:
ROYALE CHULAN HOTEL KUALA LUMPUR MALAYSIA
Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur blends traditional Malaysian architecture with contemporary design. Its grand façade, intricate wood carvings, and marble interiors reflect a deep appreciation for local heritage while offering the comforts of a modern 5-star hotel.
Prime Location in the Golden Triangle
Situated in the heart of Kuala Lumpur’s business and shopping district, the hotel is just a short walk from Pavilion Mall, Bukit Bintang, and the Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre—making it ideal for both leisure and business travelers

name: Trip.com Member
text: Terrible experience, don't book from this hotel!Hotel room aircond is not properly function! Room is stuffy.After complaint, they sent a technician to fix. An hour later, the Aircond is still not cold. We complaint again then they offer to move to a different room. Imagine having to repack everything after you have settled down and not able to rest just busy with the Aircond. They don't find it troublesome. Accept it or check out, no compensation. They simply just disregard my management complaint. In my opinion, their service is declining.  Royale Chulan KL is no longer what it was.Additionally, I don't recommend their dinner buffet as well. It costs RM80 per person but the food is not fresh, and it appears to have been there since the afternoon and limited selections with only like 5 main dishes.

name: Gigi Magaga
text:
My family and I have been regular guests at your hotel for many years. However, this year and the last have been the most disappointing stays we’ve ever experienced. Unfortunately, the condition of the hotel has declined severely in both cleanliness and maintenance.

Here are the issues we encountered during our stay:
•	Cockroaches were found in the restaurant, in the coffee mugs, and even in the hallways. We even stepped on them while walking.
•	Bathroom towels were torn and had an unpleasant, musty odor.
•	The bathroom had a bad smell, and cleaning staff only replaced towels without actually cleaning the bathroom.
•	The water in the bathroom had a strange and bad taste.
•	Bedding was not changed—just rearranged. The same comforters and pillows were used daily.
•	Dirt was visible under the beds, under nightstands, behind the curtains, and in corners. The dining table was never wiped.
•	Laundry service was poor—clothes were returned still smelling bad and unclean.
•	The air conditioning units in the rooms were broken and did not cool properly, causing great discomfort.
•	Water stains were visible all over the corridor ceilings. We raised this issue multiple times with staff, reporting water dripping from the ceiling, but nothing was done.

It’s truly disappointing to witness the hotel’s standard drop to this level. We used to enjoy our stay here, but now we feel uncomfortable and frustrated by how poorly the property is maintained.

We strongly urge hotel management to take this feedback seriously and act immediately to resolve these issues before more guests face the same experience.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: J F
text: A beautiful hotel, wonderful breakfast buffet with lots of options, clean rooms, the staff were always kind, helpful, and available.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Vijayandran S Meyappan
text:
We ..I my wife n son enjoyed staying in RC Penang. The hospitality was great. Room is very clean n well taken care.
Breakfast .. there are so many items to choose n very tasty food available. It was more than b’fast.

For the health.. we were at the gym n as there was no one we were waiting outside, a man came running. He then guided us into the gym n we had a  good workout. After the workout, my wife wanted to swim n again this was there to guide n look into our safety. While waiting, I walked around the pool n noticed there were so many potted plants planted by this same guy. Looks like he has green hands.  Unfortunately, he has been doing all these with only one hand. The great guy is Selva. Simple guy who works very hard running up n down handling all his tasks.
Vijayandran S Meyappan
Room 448 (10/11 December 25)
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: amira nadhirah kamal ariffin
text: Very impressed with the service from Selva. He was friendly, respectful, and went the extra mile by elaborating on many things about Penang and Royale Chulan Penang. His explanations were very helpful and informative.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Radhiah Fadzli
text: Selva very nice and friendly, hardworking, please make sure he get enough pay and want to see him again!!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: 酒店位于市中心，周围各大银行，不过商场有点远，泳池，健身房都很好，早餐丰富，而且味道也特别好，有当地特色菜。
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Oscar Jon Shing Lee
text:
Stayed for a weekend to attend a friend's wedding dinner in early Nov 2025. Overall a very disappointing experience.

1) Upon checking in I realised that they arranged the 2 single beds together side by side. I was sharing the room with a friend so I called front desk to highlight this and requested for a solution. The answer given was "Oh sir you may shift the beds apart yourself". I was like what kind of attitude is this? If you can't change rooms for me, at least show courtesy by arranging someone to help shift the beds. Lack of professionalism.
2) After the first night, I woke up to the sound of water dripping. Upon inspection the air-conditioning fan coil unit has been leaking water overnight. Likely a clogged drain pan. Contacted front desk, they only arranged a technician to vacuum the water plus housekeeping to dry the carpet up slightly. No room change offered.
3) On the same night midnight (I've just got back to my room after the friend's wedding dinner), the fan coil unit was leaking again. Called front desk then technician came up to vacuum water again! Luckily the neighbouring rooms were not woken up by vacuum noises. Recurring issue within the same day.
4) The buffet breakfast on Saturday morning was miserable. Large variety of food but none were amazing. Cakoi that had a texture like churros. Doughy roti canai. My friend even felt that the coffee machine milk was going sour. Gave up and went out for local food instead.

Didn't have a pleasant experience and definitely won't be coming back. Lack of professionalism, no permanent solution provided for the FCU water leak and the furniture is rather dated. The only saving grace was the proximity to access the various streets within Georgetown. Won't recommend.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: WAN AZRIN AZAM WAN AZMI
text: Baik
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: 位置好出门方便，卫生做得特别到位，前台服务超贴心，闭眼选不踩雷的好酒店！推荐 和家人朋友一起来的也可以备注要连接房
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Passport27198221422
text: Strategic location in the heart of Georgetown which made it more convenient to explore the city by foot. ||The room is elegantly romantic with a slight rustic touch that matches Georgetown's UNESCO Heritage status; along with its saltwater swimming pool, equipped gym, satisfyingly delicious breakfast and well-prepared snacks in the room.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Great hotel in an excellent location, close to all major tourist attractions. The price is reasonable, the rooms are spacious, and the entire property is very clean. Service was also attentive and pleasant throughout my stay.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Perda Bukit Mertajam
text:
We recently hosted our Showcase and Graduation Ceremony for Genius Aulad Bayan Baru and Genius Aulad Bandar Perda at Royale Chulan Penang, and the entire experience was truly remarkable. It was an important and meaningful day for our children, parents, and team.The hotel’s outstanding service made the occasion even more memorable.

Our heartfelt appreciation goes especially to Puan Yana, who has been an absolute pleasure to work with. Her kindness, patience, and unwavering dedication were evident in every interaction. She handled each detail with such sincerity and warmth, offering guidance and support that gave us complete peace of mind. Her professionalism, coupled with her gentle personality, made the entire journey smooth and comforting. We are genuinely grateful for her presence throughout this process.

We would also like to extend our deepest thanks to the banquet team, whose attentiveness and commitment were truly commendable. Every request big or small..was met with readiness, respect, and a positive spirit. Their coordination, courtesy, and meticulous service contributed greatly to the flow and success of our ceremony. Because of their efforts, our children were able to shine beautifully on stage, and our parents were able to enjoy the moment with full hearts.

Thank you, Royale Chulan Penang, for providing not just a venue, but a warm and supportive environment filled with genuine hospitality. This event holds special meaning for our centres, and we will always remember the care, kindness, and excellence shown by your team.

Lots of ♥️
Puan Rina
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Amyan10
text: Kolam & gym bersih tersusun atur.. person in charge Selva juga beri layanan yang terbaik. Peramah. 5*****
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Hafiz Zul
text: Good
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: One of the best hotel in seremban , friendly and polite  staff , room was ok slightly old ,had slight unpleasant smell when enter the room . After turn on the air conditioner then ok . Plus point , pool was well maintained, breakfast was great . My kids were happy . Will come again .
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Aizat Azhari
text: Good experience to stay here
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Jeffrey Lim
text:
Good value for money,
Room and bathroom is spacious,
There is a lot of room for improvement in customer service.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Adyla Rahman
text:
The room is spacious but its decor felt like it hadn't been updated for years. The furniture was old and showing signs of wear and tear. On the first day of my stay, my room had electrical trip while trying to use the iron but the engineering team was quick to attend and solve the issue.

The breakfast buffet was rather lack of choices, otherwise taste was decent. During the third day of my stay - during breakfast, one of the hotel’s chef was seen talking loudly to his colleague. Whatever the dispute may be, please be professional as this situation will obviously make the hotel’s guests felt unease.

If you ever stay in Royale Chulan KL and Penang, you will understand how my expectation would be.

Otherwise the hotel is strategically located, near town and with a mall within walking distance. Front desk staffs were polite, attentive and friendly.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: Nice place to stay with good services. Nearby had shopping mall and food to eat.

text: Hotel yang bagus. Lokasi berdekatan dengan pusat bandar tetapi di kawasan yang damai, tidak sesak. Parking banyak. Bilik selesa. Semua peralatan dan kelengkapan dalam bilik dalam keadaan baik. Sarapan disediakan dan banyak pilihan menu dan lazat. Servis para pekerja juga bagus, mesra dan sentiasa sedia membantu. Pada saya ini hotel terbaik untuk diduduki di Seremban.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member

text: Location is good near to town area, hotel abit old but so far service ok. Staff very helpful and friendly.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Edmund JP
text:
Royale Chulan Seremban is an older hotel, and it shows in the dated room furnishings, TV, and bathroom fixtures. However, despite its age, the hotel is very well maintained. Everything is clean, quiet, and cosy, making for a comfortable stay.

The staff are friendly and helpful, adding warmth to the overall experience.

One of its best features is its strategic location in the city centre, within walking distance to Seremban’s charming old town and various local eateries and shops.

While it may not offer modern luxuries, it has its own nostalgic charm and remains a reliable and pleasant choice for travellers looking for comfort and convenience in Seremban. A lovely stay overall.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: yasminshaufi
text: room is good, location is good, however the management is very poor. We booked a room online, registered at the counter upon check-in, received the room card and our room number given by the receptionist herself after the data has been keyed in, got into our room and suddenly got bombarded by doorbell few times after another because another guests also got the same room. Staff came and questioned us as if WE were the one at fault for being in the room THEY gave us. Be fr, how are we in the bedroom without being keyed in the system?? We got a wedding in an hour yet still no update from the receptionist after we rang them few times (not answered.) What a bad experience to start the day.

name: Haizal “IXZAL” Ibrahim
text:
Pekerja sangat Ramah dan mesra TAPI
1.Valet Parking tiada QR atau Cash less system walaupun hotel 5star.
2. Bilik besar dan nampak mewah TAPI
a)kunci pintu secure lock dah tak berfungsii bilik 245.
b)Aircond maxsimum pun x sejuk.
c)Air drpd toilet bila kita guna tiada penghadang meleleh keluar hingga ke pintu carpet area.
3. Restoran pula makanan sarapan sedap² layanan baik² TAPI kerusi hati² yg depan chinatown tu bergoyang² sandar dah nak patah risau.
4. Check out minta resit tak provide sbb kita book online katanya, sedangkan hotel 2 star pun provide.

Harap komen ini membantu pengusaha menaik taraf perkhidnatan di masa akan datang.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: Vintage feels at the center of KL
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Arjen Traas
text:
Sizable hotel in Seremban that is past its glory days. Rooms are relatively spacious and have all the basic amenities, but miss more modern adaptations. We removed some bugs from our bathroom several times. Otherwise it's clean, just dated.
There is a reasonably decked out breakfast buffet, with Western and Asian choices. But again relatively basic.
Service overall is friendly. When looking at the price / quality, this is quite an ok choice. As long as you have the right expectations, this hotel is a fine choice
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Earl Pruitt
text: Very nice hotel, aging, but well maintained. However, our room had a moldy air con system so room was musty and moldy smelling. I suspect it's the same for other rooms. Restaurant was decent with a buffet and Chinese Dim Sum on the weekends. Nice pool appears to be salt disinfected rather than chlorinated, which was super appreciated. If they would hire an ozone mold and odor removal to get rid of the mold, this would be a top notch hotel.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

quite old hotel, but very neat and clean, plenty (empty?) parking spots. rooms are very clean and everything in working order. but it's just a little bit..... old
basic amenities is provided.  service is superb, warm and very helpful staffs are always ready for support.

breakfast is okay with quite choices from nasi lemak to traditional snacks.

for transit and business trips, this might be a smart choice.

Selva is so friendly and kind, and he is actively seeking ways to improve the environment of the hotel, very valuable staff for the hotel to have. Breakfast is very scrumptious, very well rounded types of food, all hotel staff are very kind. Will definitely come back again.

name: Trip.com Member
text: Room was not only clean but also had a smelled fresh. I also noticed the lobby had a fresh scent, which made a great first impression. I appreciate the helpful and friendly staff who assisted with my check-in on the night of 2nd Dec. Overall, I had a wonderful stay, thank you!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: A very good location for local food surrounded by heritage buildings.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Luaran tidak begitu menarik kerana tiada pintu masuk dari tepi jalan. Perlu masuk lorong ke belakang untuk ke lobi. Ruang dalaman bersih dan bau wangi. Bilik selesa dan berkarpet. Sarapan ada banyak pilihan juga 👍👍👍
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Fateh Najwan
text: Great hotel, always loved the hospitality and warmth. Room is comfy and comfortable.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Man Sich
text: A more rustic feel. Nice and cosy.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Morich Hau Kouk Chiang
text: Attended a wedding in main hall, great place for leisure. Clean and neat. Parking no hassle, would definitely recommend to anyone travelling to Penang👍
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Muhamad Amirudin
text:
The room itself was old-fashioned but still manageable. Unfortunately, the real issue was the hospitality. Breakfast was served in a large hall, but because of another priority event, the management was completely disorganized. Guests were forced to share big round tables—more like a wedding banquet than a hotel breakfast. The chef refused to accommodate simple requests, which made the experience even worse.

For the price we paid, we expected genuine hospitality and proper service. Instead, we received poor management and a lack of care for guests. This was our first and last visit here. Think carefully before booking.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: James Wick
text:
We had a wonderful 2 night stay at this hotel. Close to eateries, cafes and shops alike.

What truly stands out are the employees. They are super friendly, helpful and they greet you everywhere you go within the hotel.

The breakfast buffet is really good. Coffee machines everywhere along with juices complement the vast array of food. No complaints here from.our group.

The only downside and hence only 4 stars was the parking. They explained to us that it's a one time payment of rm5 regardless of how many times you use the car. You need to scan a specific QR code and follow the simple instructions. However, when we were about to leave for home, the parking system charged us RM10 instead. As we were in a hurry, we didn't bother to sort this out.

Overall, a lovely hotel, we enjoyed ourselves and we shall return.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: stevepeacock
text: 1st time back in Penang since 1981 for a wedding anniversary trip. Hotel was 1st class with pleasant and helpful staff, especially the front reception. Well placed for easy access to areas we wanted to visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Attic rooms have excellent view and a balcony bath.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Terry52
text: We picked this hotel because it was listed as a heritage hotel in Georgetown and were surprised by a few things. First, do not be misled by the photo showing the nice front. You actually enter the hotel via an alley and rear car park. If you wanted to walk anywhere, you had to walk down alleys or through the car park. Second, if you like a drink in the evening, bring your own duty-free liquor or find a shop selling beer because this is a dry hotel. There is a big, beautiful bar but it is now a milk bar and has large teddy bears draped on chairs to give it some appeal. Didn't work. I did not see a single person using this milk bar in the six days I was there. The food and staff were very nice, also concierge services were very helpful. Our suite was on the top floor and was large and had a nice balcony with harbour views. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, but I can't get past the idea of having an international hotel but no bar even though it is in a Muslim dominated country. Even in Dubai and Doha, hotels have bars.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Chian Wong
text: Great location. Comfortable stay. The welcome pack of local snacka is a lovely gesture. I enjoyed the buffet breakfast, especially the prata naan thosai nasi lemak stations with the delectable curries & chutney
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Yana Ramli
text: Royal Chulan Terbaik. Good Servis. Good staff Selva yg banyak tunjuk ajar dalam gym. Jaga Kebersihan yg mantap.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: I am a local tourists that stayed at many 5 star hotels domestic and overseas.  It was the first time in my hotel stay experience the concierge say no to request of having another 1 piece of towel for my baby. Royal chulan should be a hotel that upholds service not to reject customer basic room requests. Very shocked with the response of the concierge.Apart from the service, the hotel is very old. The shower room leaked water and the water flowed until the entrance. Luckily I, my wife and child did not slipped and fell on the floor. In addition the room smells very bad with old carpets. Overall, basic customer services and room maintenance needs to be improved.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Lucerne Sau
text:
傳統的酒店，房間內有行李架、書桌、衣櫥。鏡子有點多。備品很多，每天補充。我訂的房間有一個露台，面向游泳池，但露台沒有放椅子，欄杆也太高，不能享受露台的陽光，可惜！

花灑頭斷丟，前台派人來維修，服務良好。

早餐選擇很多，西式/中式的也有，只是品質一般。早上8點到9點是繁忙時間，桌子幾乎都坐滿。不介意的可以9點20分鐘後到，食物仍然很多，不過家庭客都幾乎走掉，比較清淨。

游泳池面積中等，有按摩池，但按摩池的水不是熱的。維持也不錯。
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Hyangbee 2014
text: Very good hotel and I went to swimming pool Selva service and give advice very nice, hotel room also nice and clean. I recommend you to visit this hotel ☺️
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Khairul Farhan
text: Good service from selva.do assist me for all the need at pool and gyms.superb customer services from selva.keep it up
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Laura Kapitány
text: Nice stay, good breakfast, everyone is very helpful. Selva takes great care of the gym and swimming pool area, he’s also ready to help with recommendations, anything.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: OUSSET Yann
text:
Pas bon du début à la fin. Je ne reviendrai pas.

J’ai l’habitude de voyager mais c’est inadmissible pour du 5*, (sans doute très bien par le passé).

Tout commence lors de mon arrivée. L’hôtel peine à me réserver un taxi/transport pour le lendemain et me conseille de gérer par moi même en grab, on marche sur la tête.

J’ai eu un dîner professionnel, tous d’accords pour dire que la cuisine est surgelée, de mauvaise qualité.

La piscine était fermée et pas mal d’éléments de la salle de sport « en maintenance ».

Hôtel très défraîchi, aux odeurs d’humidités.

Le personnel n’est franchement pas agréable.

Point positif, chambre spacieuse mais sale, moquette tachée, serviettes ne sentent pas bon, les draps sont troués (marques de cigarettes) et fenêtre abîmée laissant entre l’air. L’air conditionné fait le bruit d’un tracteur.

J’ai fait exprès de choisir cet hôtel, sur la base de commentaires qui ne reflètent pas la réalité. Je reviendrai aux tours classiques des grandes chaînes…

À fuir
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Tayyab Imtiaz
text: It is very good to stay. Have Good Quality rooms there.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: farrukh javed
text: Good hotel for stay in malaysia
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: This accommodation is one that I would not recommend because the rooms were old and outdated. You are able to get a more newer and modern room for the same price. My family enjoyed the breakfast because they like Indian food. (The puri and egg station is a nice touch). The seating inside with air-conditioning was occupied. I recommend placing fans on the patio. I must say that the check-in was quick and simple. The bathrooms were not cleaned. We booked four rooms and they were placed on different floors. The staff is very friendly but the facilities are outdated and not maintained. If you are a light sleeper then the AC will keep you up and there is no view from your view if you are interested in hanging out in the room. The TV is outdated and has no USB charging port like other modern accommodations. The swimming pool is at the center of the courtyard surrounded by rooms of guests, perfect for getting a little toasty and being on center stage. Well, this is my first and last stay at this accommodation. I recommend the Pullman up the road or Dorsett. I hope this helps when making your decision.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: If you are looking for a value-for-money 5 star hotel that is downtown and close to everything. Look no further. This hotel offers spacious room, top tier service, and everything you can ask for in terms of facilities and service, And that's not it.The location of the hotel is close to a metro line and is around 10min walk from Kuala lumpur iconic alan Bukit Bintang street that have kuala lumpur top-tier malls including Pavilion Kuala Lumpur mall, While sadly you cant see the Petronas Twin Towers from your room anymore because of the newly built skyscrapers, It is still 10min drive from it, or a 20min walk if your into walking.I Also enjoyed the breakfast offered by the hotel its variety and taste wont disappoint you!
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Mohamed Sohail
text: I stayed at Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur with my family for three nights in December 2024. The hotel was very welcoming. The staff were friendly, and the food was very tasty. We had a good time. However, the rooms need some fixing and updating. The furniture and other things in the room were a bit old. It would be better if the rooms were renovated. Other than that it's a very good hotel in the main city.

text: Gym very clean and nice, good customer service from serva 👍👍
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Nawar Anisah Abdul Salam
text:
Wonderful Stay with Excellent Service, but Room for Improvement

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Royale Chulan Hotel in Penang, and overall, it was a fantastic experience. The hotel itself is beautifully designed, and the amenities were top-notch, making for a very comfortable stay.

A special mention goes to the front desk team, who were incredibly attentive and professional. They knew their products well and were always ready to assist with any questions or requests. Their excellent service really made us feel welcome from the moment we checked in. However, I did encounter a staff member, Joel, who unfortunately left a negative impression. His attitude was somewhat rude and unfriendly, which stood in stark contrast to the otherwise wonderful staff I interacted with.

On a brighter note, I must give a huge shoutout to the housekeeping team, particularly Arslan, Siva the Gym staff, who did a tremendous job maintaining cleanliness and ensuring the room was always pristine. His attention to detail was evident, and he made sure we had everything we needed during our stay.

Pls also look into the room and its water pressure, possibly some plumbing issues that you may need to address

In conclusion, I highly recommend Royale Chulan Hotel for its great facilities and outstanding service, though I hope the hotel can address the service inconsistency.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Great location. Beautiful old building. Lucky to have a Seaview. Room and bed was comfortable.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: RealTT
text: Stayed 4 nights in Nov 2025. The room was never cleaned until I had to complain on the last day. This is an absolute failure of a basic hotel service. One of the worst travel experiences of my life. Do not recommend. Will never stay here again.

text: awesome breakfast and dinner
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Mr Jamil
text:
Royale Chulan Penang – A Very Pleasant Stay

The hotel is clean and beautiful, with a classy heritage atmosphere from the lobby all the way to the room. The staff were genuinely polite and helpful — from the front desk to the café team, everyone provided excellent service and made us feel welcomed.

The room was spacious and comfortable, with everything in place for a relaxing stay.

Breakfast was really good — plenty of variety and everything tasted fresh and delicious. They offered a nice mix of local and western options, and the café staff were friendly and attentive.

The location is very strategic, close to many food spots and attractions around Georgetown. Parking is available; you just need to follow the heritage building layout, but it’s still manageable.

Overall, our stay at Royale Chulan Penang was very satisfying and definitely worth it. With great service and a delicious breakfast, I highly recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: nr shawaa
text: Having a great service from Mr.Selva.. swimming pool and gym was great. Swimming pool always clean. Mr Selva service was excellent. Sincerely from my family. Will repeat again to this Hotel again.. recommended hotel and please search for Mr Selva for great service.

title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: C K Teo
text:
This was my second time staying at this hotel, and unfortunately, the experience was far worse than before. Upon entering the room, I immediately noticed several problems:

- **Faulty door lock** – The door couldn’t lock properly, raising safety concerns.
- **Dirty and moldy bedsheets** – The bedding had visible stains and even mildew.
- **Broken toilet flush** – The flush was extremely hard to press.
- **Unstable shower temperature** – The shower tap couldn’t maintain a fixed temperature, as it kept sliding on its own.

I reported these issues to customer service and requested clean bedsheets and repairs. However, after waiting **over 15 minutes** with no response, I had to call again. Another **5-6 minutes** passed before a maintenance staff arrived, only to briefly inspect the room and suggest a room change instead of fixing anything.

The hotel itself is **badly worn out** and clearly lacks proper maintenance. Even after changing the bedsheets, the new ones still had **stains and discoloration** on the pillows and duvet covers.

Additionally, the **parking system** was inconvenient—guests must use a **Touch 'n Go card to enter**, but upon exiting, they have to go to the front desk for payment and scanning before leaving.

Given the **poor condition, lack of cleanliness, and inefficient service**, I would **not recommend** this hotel if you have better options.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: Bilik bersih dan luas
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: asyrafafnana
text: If you’re looking for a five‑star stay right in Kuala Lumpur’s Golden Triangle, Royale Chulan KL delivers on almost every front. Here’s why it’s become my go‑to choice for solo trips, business stopovers, and family getaways alike:||What Makes It Shine| • Unbeatable Location|Steps from Bukit Bintang, Pavillion, and the city’s major business hubs, you can walk or rideshare anywhere in minutes.| • True 24‑Hour Service|Whether you crave a late‑night supper or need an extra pillow at 3 a.m., room service and housekeeping respond promptly—without the dreaded “after‑hours” surcharge.| • Full Five‑Star Facilities|A well‑equipped gym, relaxing spa, outdoor pool, multiple dining outlets, and plenty of secure, covered parking mean you rarely have to leave the property unless you want to.| • Flexible Accommodation|Choose between classic hotel rooms or spacious serviced apartments—perfect for extended stays or families who like a kitchenette.||People Who Make It Special| • Front‑Desk Superstars: Jamie, Naiman, and Kathir greet you like old friends, handle requests lightning‑fast, and somehow remember every guest’s name.| • Voice of Hospitality: Halen (operator) is incredibly warm and efficient—expect your calls to be answered with genuine cheer.| • Honourable Mentions: Though no longer on the desk, I still miss Suzy (Sales), Danialli, and Sukdev—their legacy of excellent service lives on.||The rooms are spacious and well laid out, but some carpets and wall paint now show their age. A light refurbishment would easily elevate Royale Chulan KL from “very good” to “exceptional,” matching the stellar service the team already provides.||For locals seeking a city staycation or visitors wanting a central base, Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur offers superb value, genuine Malaysian hospitality, and every five‑star convenience you need—plus a parking spot waiting downstairs. Highly recommended, and I can’t wait to see the refreshed rooms on my next visit!
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Pavithra Umapathey
text:
This hotel no longer lives up to its 4-star rating. It may have earned that status many years ago, but the current room quality does not reflect it. For the price charged, the experience was disappointing. This review is purely to raise awareness, as the hotel would be more accurately rated as a 3-star property.

There were several issues observed in the room, including a broken strip and stained bedsheets, among others. Despite having pre-booked our rooms, we were not given the appropriate ones, which further affected our overall experience.

The only positive aspect is its strategic location, which is convenient and accessible.

We sincerely hope the hotel management takes this feedback constructively and makes the necessary improvements to uphold the standards expected of a 4-star establishment, or otherwise consider revising its rating to a 3-star hotel instead.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Chu Ah Mie
text:
Just wanted to give a massive thank you to the whole team at Royal Chulan Penang, for making our recent government event from 25-27 October 2025 so successful. The service was top-notch and made everything run so smoothly. To Puan Mahsuri, the Sales Manager, was a true lifesaver during the planning. She was so on top of everything and super helpful with all our requests. She really kind, generous, hardworking and knows her stuff! A big thanks to Mr. Hafiz, Puan Mahsuri's assistant, for his hard work and always being ready to lend a hand. We really appreciate it! Ms. Devika, Mr. Joel, and Ms. Raina were all fantastic. They were so helpful, welcoming and friendly! We can’t forget the kitchen team, either! The food was absolutely delicious throughout our entire stay esp the breakfast. Seriously, a huge compliment to the chefs.  Lastly to all the lobby, dining, hall staff, thank you for being so polite and always ready to help. The entire experience was just brilliant, and it’s all thanks to the dedication of your team. We’ll definitely be recommending your hotel to others. OTHER HOTELS MAY MATCHES THE ROOM CAPACITY AND THE FACILITIES BUT THE PEOPLE MADE THIS HOTEL REAL STANDOUT FROM ANOTHER.
Cant wait for our next project!
Thanks again!

P/s: To the GM: Ur Teddy Bear idea is soo cool! lurve!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

text: Last stayed here two years ago. The hotel is dated, needs a good overhaul. Okay, it is cheaper than most in KL, but two years ago it was an excellent experience and a pleasure to stay. What has happened? What can I say?|Toilet wouldn’t flush. Light bulbs not working, air con not working, tv remote with no batteries, towels all shredded on the edges. Shower not waterproof and spilled out into the bathroom. |The hotel requests you use the safe in your room. We couldn’t. It had been locked whilst open. We got told they couldn’t fix it but they would put our valuables in a safe at reception, which was inconvenient. The male member of staff acted as though he couldn’t care less.|We had booked to return for one night in the following week but cancelled.|We won’t be returning.

And there is a huge development feet from the hotel and noise is constant.room requests made months in advance e are not honoured....we have come here for 10 years and it's a shame we wont return,the hotel main revenue seems to be the stream of tour groups from India and china and not leisure travellers

After taking our order, he disappeared, and when we wanted to pay, we had to walk around just to find someone to help. The food also didn’t taste good. Hopefully, the management can really improve both the service and food quality, it’s such a waste, especially given the great location in Penang.

name: haebaraki
text: Had our 1 night stay here, though it looked a bit old and run down for the room, it was well maintained. Although the hotel was in the middle of busy Georgetown, they do provide multiple storey carpark which they charged for rm5 per stay. Please add breakfast for your stay cause it was unexpectedly delicious and they offered variety of foods. I did not give high expectations for their breakfast at first cause i've been to royale chuln villa in kuantan and the breakfast was average. Super love their hokkien sup which was flavorful, roti canai which was crispy, their ayam pandan was exceptionally tasty and they got cakoi which finished early. Their room was basic but the bed was comfy and large. The aircond was cold and shower working well. I was touched by their handwritten memo left on table, it was very cute! Thanks for making our stay comfortable and great!

name: iklil fatihah (Faith)
text:
⭐️⭐️ Wonderful Stay at Royale Chulan – Exceptional Service!

I recently stayed at the Royale Chulan and had a truly pleasant experience. The hotel itself is beautiful and well-maintained, offering a calm and comfortable environment right in the heart of the city.

A special mention goes to Selva from the pool area – his warm hospitality, attentiveness, and friendly attitude really stood out. He made sure guests were comfortable and went out of his way to offer assistance with a genuine smile. It’s staff like him who make a stay memorable!

Overall, I had a great time and would definitely recommend the Royale Chulan to anyone looking for excellent service, comfort, and that special touch of Malaysia
title: Royale Chulan Penang

text: I really love this five-star hotel with a traditional Malaysian style. Not only are the staff friendly and courteous, but the breakfast is also diverse. Nail was rusted and was protruding through the carpet. Lamp shades in my room were broken. Wall papers were loose. Needs lots of work to bring the hotel back to its good old days. For now I was not happy. The restaurant was good though...

name: DocBrown
text:
Das Hotel liegt perfekt mitten in der Altstadt. Von außen wirkt es von der Schnellstraße etwas unscheinbar, auch ist die Zufahrt erfolgt von hinten über den Hof. Diese erste Eindruck täuscht aber definitiv, es ist ein TOP-Hotel mit perfektem Service und tipp-top sauberen Zimmern. Im Bad sogar eigene Trinkwasserspender.

Das Hotel hat einen schönen Pool. Sehr sauber. Handtuchservice.

Das Frühstück ist ein Traum mit allem was man sich so vorstellen kann.

Das Beste und wichtigste ist die Lage. Es ist ein perfekter Standort um das UNESCO-Welterbe Zentrum von Georgetown zu Fuß anzuschauen. In fußläufiger Nähe zudem zahlreiche, gute Restaurants. Tipps: D'Sakra (indisch) und Via Pre Penang (italienisch). Haben uns beide absolut überzeugt.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

Also, while we were having our food, the staff seemed irritated and did not treat us well. I hope management can look into these issues and ensure better hygiene and friendlier service for all customers. Apart from that, everything was good n excellent

name: Sakinah Inspired
text:
Saya ambil pakej staycation untuk ramadan 2025
ni. Saya sangat tidak berpuas hati dengan susunan meja sewaktu berbuka puasa. Lokasi tempat duduk yang terlalu jauh dari buffet makanan dan tidak balance (area sebelah kiri). Hampir kesemua makanan diletakkan di tengah2 dan kami terpaksa ulang2 alik banyak kali untuk ambil makanan kami dan anak2 kami. Jauh dari live band dan segala makanan. Sepatutnya boleh je tnya kami kalau kami nak tempat duduk yang lebih dekat, swap meja ke tapi tak di offer pun. Makanan pun tak semua refill macam laksa ikan sekor. So2 dissappointed dengan pengurusan tempat duduk untuk orang yang nk iftar di situ.👎🏻
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Syafiq Shaari
text:
It is draining to the rabbit hole. Used to be glorious venue literally for everything but not anymore. Room was so bad. Had to switch to another room due to major pipe leaking (from the wall !).

Lots of broken item in the room. Dirty floor in the bathroom. Look at the iron board. TV unit was from early 2000 i guess? The hotel need major refurbish. Staff weren’t really friendly. Before covid,the breakfast was major hit. But not anymore. Same fruits (and limited) for 4 nights during my stay.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Trip.com Member
text: The location of the hotel was superb. Walking distance to Mrt Conlay. An average hotel with reasonable price for stay.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Abdul Raheem
text:
Staying at the Royal Chulan Kuala Lumpur was a pretty good experience overall. It’s a beautiful five-star hotel with an elegant vibe, and we booked the superior double bed room. Most of the stuff was spot on, the bed was super comfortable, the washroom was clean and well-maintained, the Jacuzzi was a nice touch, and the lockers were convenient and secure.

But if I’m being honest, the AC was a bit of a letdown. It just didn’t cool the room the way I expected, and in a hotel of this standard, you kind of expect everything to be perfect, especially something as basic as air conditioning.

That said, we still had a great time. The hotel’s atmosphere, the service, and the overall comfort made up for that one hiccup. Would I stay here again? Probably, but I’d definitely check the AC first!
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Tina Tim
text: A hotel is designed in a traditional style which contrasts with the modern architecture all around. Good location, spacious swimming pool and room. You can feel that the hotel is old so a lot of things are not working in the room, for example sockets or lamps. Also it is a little bit noisy because there is some construction nearby. The breakfasts are average, I consider it to be very rare in general when the buffet breakfast is tasty. The staff is polite and helpful, I was provided some space for a meeting when needed.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: anupamgarg04
text: A nice hotel with grand look. The rooms, however, were in bad state. The Room Safe was non-operational, pillow covers and bed covers were dirty & worn-out. Even towels were dirty. We had to call housekeeping to replace all. ||The breakfast, though, was nice and very elaborate, with good veg food options (it has a separate South Indian counter). But there was almost no veg food option in room service menu. Moreover, in room service, they insisted on paying upfront instead of adding in room bill which was an inconvenience.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: yorkspuds
text: Arrived here having arrived by road from Malacca.||Impressive, if slightly old-fashioned lobby - and quickly checked in by reception. Up to the fourth floor to room 423. Our hearts sank when we saw the building site next door! But in all honesty we weren’t disturbed by it and the construction workers knocked off at 8pm and didn’t restart until 8am, so no big deal. ||Our room turned out to be the biggest one we had on our trip. Large bathroom/dressing area, kitchen area with fridge and a small freezer compartment, microwave, electric 2-ring hob, kettle with tea & coffee, sink, kitchen cupboards. But note - no crockery, cutlery or pans, or washing-up liquid or T-towels. Just 2 mugs for tea - no glasses either! At most you can re-heat a takeaway.||Large bedroom with table & chairs, desk & chair and a sofa. Bed was comfortable. Two free-to-use safety deposit boxes and two wardrobes plus drawers. WiFi worked well. ||Now, to be absolutely honest, the hotel could do with a big refurbishment. It is  very old-fashioned and rather tatty in places. Only one electrical socket worked in our room and some overhead lights didn’t work. The toilet door didn’t close either! All that being said, it was comfortable and clean and the staff were all lovely. It’s also a low-rise building, with a lot of character and an oasis in the hustle and bustle of KL, and a change from the ever present soulless skyscrapers. |The swimming pool is glorious!||Breakfast : An absolute feast, catering for all tastes, Indian, Chinese, Western- really sumptuous and good quality. Excellent.||Close to Conlay MRT and the Pavilion Mall, the latter having a wonderful food court in the basement - highly recommended. ||So, despite the need for refurbishment, we really liked this hotel. It is truly an oasis in the concrete jungle of central KL.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Lilian Chow
text: My family stayed at the Royale Chulan recently and were very impressed with the suite that we stayed in.  My daughter just wanted to hang out in the room and not leave the couch.   The buffet breakfast was okay.  The teh tarik was nice, the omelettes were delicious but the youtiao was not very good and the soy milk was best avoided.  That said, apart from the youtiao and soy milk the rest of the breakfast was very good.  The location of the hotel is really good.  You can walk to the clan jetties, the murals, the Penang Peranakan Museum, Fort Cornwallis....  Saved us a ton in grab fees.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: DLT92150
text: International standard rooms with classic furniture. All amenities provided. Very good bedding and a large bathroom. We could see the sea from the room. We took profit of the swimming pool (large and clean). The hotel is well located to walk and to go shopping in the UNESCOs preserved area. Breakfast is gorgeous ..and turned to be somehow a brunch. The service is efficient. I recommend this hotel for a traveller who want to secure his stay in Penang.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: chan bell

Having breakfast here

name: Jill Stephanie
text:
It’s a bit rundown and some areas are not maintained well..Plasters are chipping off here and there.
Breakfast selection was plenty but not up to the mark. Very bad ventilation due to the ‘roti canai’ counter..You go in smelling nice but you smell like smoke when you come out.
Hotel staff were not friendly at all especially the female staff (Eeysa I think ) at the front desk. No smile/welcoming vibe on her face while I was approaching the counter. Her straight and unfriendly face throughout the check in process was a major drawback for me.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Nice view but there is no free parking. Some walking distance to nearby food. Nice things is the Aircorn is cold enough

text: Hai..good day. Thank you selva is very friendly person,very helpful and kindness.Explain everything when i ask something.Five star for selva for your kindness..

text: Dari check in sampai check out servis sgt terbaikkk. Breakfast banyak sangat pilihan menu. Kolam pun best dan sangat bersih. Thumbs up to mr. Selva sebab layanan yang sangat baik dan sangat membantu. Terima kasih staff2 di Royale Chulan Penang. Will come back for sure!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Saiful Hizam
text: WOW....
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Beautiful heritage hotel with a touch of colonial charm. The location is convenient, within walking distance to many attractions and eateries. Room was spacious and clean, and the staff were polite and attentive. Breakfast spread could be slightly improved, but overall it was a very pleasant stay.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Good and peaceful hotel. Good breakfast. Lovely place. Like the swimming pool and gym.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Vishnu Engkannah
text: I had a pleasant stay at Hotel Royale Chulan. The rooms were very clean and well-maintained, making it a comfortable experience. The service was excellent — the staff were attentive, friendly, and always ready to help. The pool staff Selva was very helpful and friendly. Another big advantage is its strategic location, which makes it very convenient to get around the city.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: EL Khoo
text:
Sorry this is not a suitable review as I attended event only. Food was decent.
Parking was super pricey!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Nigel
text:
Comfortable stay with a great shower pressure, a rare beast. Hotel room well appointed with mod cons including a safe. Breakfast was included and is buffet style, it caters to most people's tastes / cultures. Fantastic swimming pool, warm salt water variety. Within the pool lies a small pool that becomes a spa like once you press the button.
Close to lots of tourist spots and a huge amount of options for eating out.
Staff friendly and always willing to assist.
Enjoy George Town.....
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Danish Aiman Norizak
text: The pool attendant (SELVA) is a very nice,friendly person, he is very ambitious and give us so many ideas on how to do in penang. Great and enjoy to stay here when there have someone like this in penang 👍
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Ahmad Fauzi Zakaria
text: amazing hospitability, friendly staff, love the friendlyness! especially Silva whos incharge of the pool. Thanks for the hodpitability Royale Chulan!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Ioana Cutcutache
text:
DON’T TRUST too much the 5* reviews as the hotel is giving free drinks for the good reviews!
I was quite disappointed with this hotel after having multiple issues. First, at check-in they insisted I pay the tourist tax which I was pretty sure I already paid when I booked. Later I managed to find the invoice for that in one of the emails so had to argue with them to get a refund. Then I specifically asked for a room on a quiet side so my young daughter can sleep ok. They gave me a room next to a noisy generator. After 2 nights I had to ask to change as we couldn’t get any good sleep. The guy at front desk promised to give us a room facing the inner courtyard as someone was checking out later. When we came back he said that room is not available anymore (obviously given to someone else!) and he gave us a room facing same way as the original one, just a couple doors down. The new room was also smelling of damp. Didn’t have much choice as apparently no other twin rooms were available. The noise was a bit less in the new room but the smell didn’t go away even after leaving the aircon on for a long time. To make things worse at 10:30pm when we were sleeping they came and rang the door bell several times with a room service order which was for a different room! When I spoke to the front desk manager next day he basically said it’s our fault for not putting do not disturb on! And that they will spray the room…
The safe deposit box didn’t work in any of the 2 rooms and had to ask to get fixed every time. Second time it took very long so had to go out and take all valuables with us since couldn’t wait a couple hours for them to fix it.
This is defined not 4 star hotel service! Wouldn’t recommend, there are many hotels in Penang which would give better service, I chose this one based on reviews but then realised they were bought off.
The only ok thing is the breakfast which is decent.
UPDATE: on the last day also found big cockroach in the bathroom!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Krruzogy Explorer
text: We had a wonderful 4-day, 3-night stay at Royale Chulan Cherating. It was a great experience overall—relaxing, comfortable, and perfect for a family getaway. One of the highlights was trying out surfing for the first time, which made the trip even more memorable. Definitely a stay we truly enjoyed and would love to revisit.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Amir Adzhan A Rahman
text: Service superb
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: angah64
text: Semuanya best. Memang berbaloi sebab dia agak private. Kena dengan harga. Location agak jauh sebab kedai pun tak banyak. Tapi ada je kedai runcit kat kg cherating lama tu. Boleh la nak cari jajan or air manis.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: France Autoparts
text: The chalet was spacious, clean, and tastefully furnished with traditional Malay touches. The air conditioning worked perfectly, the bed was plush, and the private balcony offered lovely views of the garden or beach (depending on the unit). The bathroom was well-maintained with hot water and quality amenities.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: trustkill jamrock
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: nurulashiken chaharnordin
text:
We have stayed at this chalet many times — probably our 5th or 6th visit within the past two years. It is one of the cleanest and freshest-looking chaket in Cherating, and the rate was very reasonable.

The surroundings are clean and peaceful, and the room is comfortable. Although the room may look slightly dated, it is still well-maintained and perfectly fine.

Breakfast was good even though the variety was limited. However, the cereal quality could be improved, as it tasted quite cheap — even my son cant finish the cereal because the taste was terrible. We hope this can be improved in the future.

Check-in and check-out processes were smooth and hassle-free. The restaurant staff during breakfast were very friendly and attentive.

The beach is absolutely amazing — we could easily spend the whole day there from morning until evening. We will definitely come back again someday, and hopefully there will be a special gift or recognition for regular guests.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Syamil DaRreN Chin
text:
Me and wifey love to come over to Cherating. And almost every time we would stay here.

We like it here as it feels comfy and homely. The staffs are nice and courteous.

The beach here is like our own private beach, thankfully it’s clean. As is the property too.

There are shops and cafes you can walk to nearby.

One thing I would hope is that the management look into refurbishing as some parts, areas and items in the room looks dated.

All in all, a nice resort to stay in.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

Keep it up!
