title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Joe Irfan
text: Place chill n rest for family. Food ok and sea sand near the hotel
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Azly
text: Breakfast sedap, tempat cantik, selesa & bersih, front desk mesra suka senyum.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Yen L
text:
1st time book with Royale Chulan.
A very good services provided from all staff upon arrival.
Taking buggy service to reception for check -in and as well, feel the warmest from the villa service was the room been pre-on the aircond and feel the cool air when from outside hot sun.
Clean private beach and cleaniness of the room make guests feel comfort.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Ouil Gasdu
text:
Superbe hôtel à Cherating, parfaitement situé face à la plage avec un spot de surf incroyable juste devant.

Le petit-déjeuner était exceptionnel, varié et vraiment délicieux.

Les services étaient toujours au rendez-vous, avec un personnel attentif et disponible. Un endroit idéal pour se détendre, profiter de l’océan et passer un excellent séjour. Je recommande sans hésiter !
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Faha Lyanna
text:
My trip supposedly only for 3D2N dekat royale chulan chalet but tiba2x extended another night at royale chulan villa pula . . Kalau dekat chalet my room 2201 , bilik selesa,bersih, kelengkapan cukup ada iron(paling penting)& ada water dispenser mcm coway ya dekat luar. No need to buy mineral water! Yeay!  Breakfast was okay sebab ada pulut kuning (which is my favourite). Ambience for those yang memang nak rest. I will remember forever masa stay dekat chalet ni sbb after breakfast before checking out ada satu kejadian di mana ceiling dekat balcony area tiba2 runtuh and masa tu tengah lepak dekat balcony and nasib baik tak kena kepala just kena kaki. Alhamdulillah. And the staff were very kind yaa making sure we’re okay. 😊

And disebabkan that kejadian, Mr, Faiza (one of the staff) treat us dinner dekat villa tu pula. Rezeki. And during my stay dekat villa pula what i can say is i can’t buy that moment . Service dorang memang superb. Starting from dealing with Mr. Faiza for booking sangat mudah & harga boleh deal👍🏻, transferring from chalet to villa (they allowed us to stayed at chalet sampa villa room is ready to check in) . Not to forget dorang siap bawak beg kite and letak dalam bilik terus ya. Nak masuk ke villa pun very private ya sbb dorang ade each guests name so sangat safe dan private. My room masa tu 302 ocean suites sangat besar luas dan selesa, bersih, katil dia sedap betul tidur. Breakfast dia sedap banyak gila choices. And definitely will come again to stay dekat royale chulan sbb saya suka customer service dia.

For those yang nak bercuti and nak dapatkan special room rate for chalet or villa boleh cari Mr. Faiza sangat baik . Recommended .
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: S Devenda Rao Sannasy
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: HASLAM BIN HASHIM (JKR)
text:
Alhamdulillah.
Penginapan di hotel yang sangat memuaskan, bilik bersih, kemudahan diselenggara dengan baik dan layanan staf adalah amat profesional serta suasana hotel yang nyaman.
Makanan yang sedap dan rekemen sangat2. Kredit diberikan kepada Puan Syuhada Sales person yang sangat baik dan mudah berurusan.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 5/5 – Memorable Stay at Royale Chulan Villa CheratingWe stayed at Royale Chulan Villa Cherating on Deepavali eve, and the experience was truly special. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised with a free upgrade to the Premium Villa, which came with our own private swimming pool — such a perfect touch for relaxation and privacy.That night, we enjoyed the Deepavali buffet spread, and it was excellent. There was a wide variety of dishes, flavourful and festive, making the dinner feel really meaningful and celebratory.The villa itself was spacious, comfortable, and beautifully maintained. The private pool was definitely the highlight — peaceful, clean, and perfect for an evening dip.Overall, it was a memorable stay with wonderful service and thoughtful gestures. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a relaxing seaside villa experience with a touch of luxury!
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: Comfy stay. Great breakfast choices.

name: Trip.com Member
text: 地理位置很好
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Hazwan Hanizul
text:
Location:
I came here for a one night stay for an event nearby. This place used to be prestige due to its connection to the MRT & the mall next door until the mall got closed down. You have to walk around the dead building to reach The Curve mall uncovered at some part. It's gonna be really bad if its raining (luckily it didn't during my stay).

Room:
It is quite spacious & clean. It can fit like 5 people. Its very comfortable to stay in here. Amenities are complete. However, the room i got didn't have a nice chair (as per photo). Even the luggage area got some dirty spots on it.

Brakfast:
Breakfast was great. It has a wide variety of choices to choose from.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: Great for a weekend getaway. If the curtain could be entirely blind, it would be perfect

The receptionist was clueless when we asked how to get to the registration counter of MBMR. Everyone is sweating here. I don't think this is 5 star hotel, more like those 1 star hotel.

text: 前台3分钟快速办理入住，赠送了当地特色迎宾茶饮，大堂融合了现代艺术与本土文化元素，多处网红打卡点设计精巧，餐厅智能保温餐台维持着65℃的完美温度，米其林星级班尼迪克蛋在会议间隙优雅成型，胶囊咖啡机30秒奉上定制拿铁，高效与精致达成完美平衡，无论是商务出行还是休闲度假都强烈推荐，已收藏为常驻酒店名单！

text: Gym very clean and also pool
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: うーん。立地は良くて建物の外観自体は美しいのですが、サービスが残念でした。まず、部屋にタオルが一枚もない。バスタオル、フェイスタオル、バスマット、どこを探してもない。夕方にフロントに伝えたはずが、夕食を終えて戻ってきてもない。フロントにもう一度伝えたが、誰も届けに来ない。3回目にフロントに電話した後、5分後にバスタオル2枚のみ届きました。このうち1枚は謎のシミ付き。もうこれ以上は諦めましたが、タオルくらいは安心して使いたかった。

name: Trip.com Member
text: the room smelled musty
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Aicha Courbon
text:
Nous partons ce jour, de l'hôtel nous avons, utilisé leur service laundry, plus cher qu'à l'extérieur mais a notre sens plus sûr.
Ils ont perdu un t shirt Lacoste pour lequel nous avions la facture car acheté avant les vacances.
Nous avons discuté avec eux au bout de 2 jours nous échangeons avec Mr Adil qui met clairement notre parole en doute sachant qu'il pointe eux même le document listant les vêtements déposé.
Il y avait le t shirt, de plus il nous explique qu'il a essaye de nous joindre par téléphone,  limite en nous le reprochant et oui nous sommes pas tout le temps a l'hotel. Et a chaque fois on demandait a la reception s'il avait du nouveau RAS , pas de mot dans notre chambre.
Nous avons demandé un dedommagement, en justifiant avec facture aucune ouverture à ce sujet.
Je déplore que la parole des clients soient mis en doute, et qu'il ne prenne pas leur responsabilité, c'est leur laundry, c'est eux qui liste le nombre de vêtements, bref c'est leur problème.
C'est la première fois que je fais fasse a si peu d'ouverture a la discussion et surtout en le justifiant en mettant en cause la parole du client.
Super relation client .
J'ai demandé le nom du directeur Me Dennis Lee je vais lui écrire.
Cliente pas satisfaite.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: 朋友推荐的酒店，地理位置非常不错，走路去各个打卡点都很方便，走路基本都是几分钟、十几分钟的路程，酒店环境也不错，只是房间稍微小了一点。

name: Nana Shamsudin
text:
This is my 3rd time stay at Royale Chulan Penang. And I could say that this is my best experience by far. Thanks to the quick-witted and professional help from Mr Sylvester and Mr Luqman at the front desk for helping to find our otherwise lost booking. Mr Sylvester even arranged for twin room even before we ask for it (instead of the original King sized my sister and I got during booking)
And to our surprise, we even got complimentary fruits and cakes! That was so kind and thoughtful! Breakfast was great, TV channels have improved, securities at front door attentive. Will definitely stay here again! Recommended for anyone coming to Georgetown from Butterworth as it is very near to the jetty (Weld Quay).

name: Diana Daniels
text: Stayed here from 30th July till 3rd August. Brought my aunt and her husband along. I rented a car together with a driver so it's easy to go anywhere with elderly folks. Reception staff were friendly, especially the lady who checked us in. Gosh I can't remember her name though, my apologies. The door security abangs and bellhop guy were friendly too and helpful. The coffeehouse wait staff were attentive during breakfast hour and plates on tables are cleared fast, food was constantly replenished and ESPECIALLY THE DONUT RACK was enticing. Even the housekeeping guy named Hossain who cleaned both my room and my aunt's; I want to say a BIG THANK YOU as our rooms were clean properly and what is needed replenished everytime. I have nothing but praises for Royal Chulan Penang and I will shall definitely book this hotel again on my future Penang visits. Thank you.

However, all Operational Staff on Duty was very cheerful and friendly. Hoping that Royal Chulan can improve this as I remember their Ramadan buffet is delicious. Thank you

text: Staying at Royale Chulan Cherating Villa was truly one of the best experiences we’ve had. The place is absolutely stunning, with beautiful sandy beaches and a serene atmosphere. The staff were also exceptionally helpful and friendly, providing excellent service throughout our stay.Overall, it was a wonderful getaway, and we would highly recommend it.

name: Chu Tue
text:
Be careful when you make the booking. There is Royale Chulan Chalet and Royale Chulan villa. I don’t know about the Villa, but the Chalet is like 30 years old dormitory.
When my car arrive at the reception of the Chalet there is no one to welcome you. There is a big jug of tea for self service. I saw the plaque showing rating of more than 8 from Trip Advisor, my first thought was this must be a purposely mixed up rating of the Villa and Chalet. Please note that these 2 has completely separate entrance. After receiving my room key, i walked up to my room, the stair full of dust and old with many stained marks. The room is a bit cleaner but everything looks very old and shabby. Tiny dressing desk with no light or power point. No slipper, comb, tooth brush in the room. I called up the reception twice to only get the slipper. They don’t have comb. Make sure you book the correct Royale Chulan.

The curtain has molded and the bathroom is very very small despite the charging price. For a price like that, i couldve gotten better room and elsewhere with better accommodities.

View is quite nice. However the food was below mid and below expectations, the menu for breakfast is the same every single day. So there arent many options to be chose from. Buggy service is also very slow. If I call for one, the waiting time for the buggy to show up can take up till 40 mins just for a 5 min ride. Please see to this matter accordingly
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Amnie Nabila
text:
Hi Team Royal Chulan Cherating Chalet,

I would like to make a complaint regarding our stay from 15 November 2025 to 16 November 2025.

We made a booking through the Agoda app for 3 people. However, upon arrival for check-in, the reception staff (Syazwan / Mastura / Intan — not sure who handled it) did not seem to check our booking properly. They informed us that our room was only for 2 people, and asked us to add on 1 sofa bed for RM60 and an additional breakfast for RM33.

We were very confused because our Agoda booking clearly stated 3 guests. Since we were tired after travelling from KL and it was already late, we decided to check in first and clarify the matter later.

Shortly after that, we received a call from Mastura asking again about our booking and the “sofa bed” request. This made us even more frustrated, as it showed that the first receptionist did not properly verify our Agoda booking.

We are extremely disappointed because:
• We paid for 3 people, but were given a room meant for 2 people.
• The receptionist did not double-check our booking and made us feel as if we were at fault for having 3 guests.
• The overall service made our check-in experience uncomfortable and unpleasant.
• The room provided was clearly for 2 pax, and adding an extra mattress made the room even smaller and uncomfortable.

Although Mastura eventually called us again to adjust the booking and add the extra pax, we remain dissatisfied and disappointed, as we expected a smoother process and a more comfortable experience—especially since our booking was correctly made for 3 guests from the beginning.

We hope the Chalet can look into this matter seriously and improve the check-in process and customer service for future guests.

Therefore, what surprise us also is the receptionist (Syazwan/Intan/Mastura) also don’t give us a key to locked our room. They’re not even concerned our safety. We know this after we checkout, the receptionist ask us about key. THIS IS REALLY BAD EXPERIENCE AND ALSO OUR FIRST AND LAST GO HERE. Apologies doesn’t make anything change.

Thank you for the bad experience.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: hanisah hasan
text:
Mulanya agak sedikit kecewa sebab requested room under renovation and none of the staffs inform me eventhough i put remarks in the email or when i made an advance call to double check my reservation. So i have been located to another room but there was an event in the next room so i have to keep my curtain closed most of the time. But im trying to be positive, the warmth service from staffs reduce the disappointment. Everyone was super friendly and kind, feel like one big family. All staffs are locals and i love supporting our local friends because interaction they made make me feel like i was back in my kampung. Hotel has an app where you can chat with the staffs directly. Introverts love these. Hotel landscape was maintained beautifully, great for morning walk. The beach was magnificent. It was clean and clear water. There is no direct sunrise or sunset here to see but that also means great to spend time on beach because it was not that hot and sunny. The waves was not really strong, safe for kids. Room was clean, tidy with some juices provided in the fridge. The toiletries shower gel and body lotion smells so good. Water pressure was strong. There's only one thing turned down, it was the pillows. The pillows made my neck hurts next day. They should change the pillows to better ones.
Breakfast buffet was a lot of varieties. Foods are great only that sambal nasi lemak and curry mee a little salty. Fruits served was all fresh and sweet. Macaroni was delicious and drinks was nice too. Lastly, hopefully can visit this hotel again next time. Keep it up management team!
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Nurliza Mohd Sahar
text:
Lokasi: Berhampiran dengan pantai yang bersih dan juga berdekatan dengan tarikan seperti Limbong Art, Pusat Perlindungan Penyu Cherating, dan Kompleks Budaya Cherating.
Keselesaan: Bilik-bilik yang selesa dengan bilik mandi yang bersih.
Kemudahan: Menawarkan pakej yang terbaik bagi Bengkel/Mesyuarat.
Sesuai untuk Keluarga: Ia sangat sesuai untuk keluarga, dengan bilik keluarga dan kanak-kanak berusia 2 hingga 11 tahun boleh menginap secara percuma menggunakan tempat tidur sedia ada.
Makanan: Pelbagai masakan tempatan dan desert yang sangat sedap disediakan oleh chef.

text: Very centrally located but quiet. Friendly service, clean and good breakfast.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Deborah Hill
text:
I stayed at Royale Chulan Penang for 4 nights with my family.
The location was excellent — close to George Town’s historic centre, street art, shops, and a wide range of restaurants. It was easy to get around and enjoy what Penang has to offer.

The room was clean and comfortable, with great beds and an excellent shower. The air conditioning worked well and was pleasantly quiet.

The gym was good but I feel the pool facilities could be improved, with some food and drink facilities.

The reception staff were very helpful and accommodating with a special request I had, which made check-in smooth. The staff in the restaurant were also helpful when I mentioned I was vegan.

I was however, disappointed that several vegetable dishes — which could have easily been vegan — were prepared with chicken stock or fish sauce. It would be great if the kitchen could avoid using animal products in otherwise plant-based , giving more options to vegan and vegetarian guests without having to prepare something separately.

Overall, it was a comfortable and enjoyable stay with good service and a convenient location. I’d be happy to stay again.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

text: Gym & pool clean. Staff selva very helpful and very good. Informative & joyful

text:

name: Max Azwan
text: You removed free parking for guest hotels, and every guest has to pay the parking fee for a 5-star hotel? Do you not hear how ridiculous this sounds? Took my time to write this, stayed here multiple times, and once they 'improved' their parking system to plate-based, parking fee is charged! It's not about how much, but the principal in place. You look cheap, as a 5-star. Bring back the free parking for guest! Even Ibis Sri Damansara, a 3-star hotel can provide free parking. Don't you think how embarrassing this is to Royal Chulan brand? Also, the tagline Malaysia Hospitality sounds familiar? Be original, and don't copy other company's branding.

name: NMAR
text:
Alhamdulillah, anniversary ke-4 tahun kami disambut dengan short getaway di sini. Semua urusan dari awal sampai check-in sangat smooth. Booking dibuat pada 21/10 dengan En. Amirul very friendly & helpful service (sangat sopan & professional)

Originally, kami nak Ocean Suite Villa, tapi not our rezeki this time sebab only Family Villa available (agak besar for 3 of us). So we decided to stay at Standard Chalet (Facing Ocean) RM253/night including breakfast for 2 pax.

Check-in process pun senang, before 3pm dah boleh check-in chalet. For your information, guest yang stay di chalet tak boleh freely access kawasan villa, unless for dining at Ocean Restaurant or spa session. Nak ke sana kena request buggy car dekat reception. Tapi jangan risau, chalet guest still boleh jalan ke area villa ikut laluan pantai yang cantik.

Swimming pool hanya ada di villa area boleh dan untuk guest chalet dikenakan charge RM3-5/pax (tak silap saya) dan wajib memakai swimming suit yang ditetapkan.

Overall, I’m satisfied with our stay here. Breakfast was delicious and suits my taste. Cuma part access ke villa agak limited, so kalau nak makan better order via room service (boleh cash or payment semasa nak check out) sebab agak hassle nak dapat permission ke Ocean Restaurant.

Still, it was a pleasant & relaxing stay calm vibe, friendly staff, and totally worth the experience. 🌿✨
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Anis Bux
text:
Been here for family vacation during 18-19Oct. What I can say - great hospitality! The staffs were so good, friendly and helpful.

Even through our car. Need to be parked downhill at the guardhouse area, the good side is their buggies operates 24h, so no worries to commute from outside to inside the resort.

Food were awsome! Their pulut kuning and rendang daging served during breakfast was perfectly cooked and so nostalgic!

Our room - Ocean Suit 308. But the bed is not superking bed size, just normal king size I guess. Complimentary food - keropok! That’s the main highlight for visiting pantai timur 🩵

Awsome experience. Will come again next time!!

text:
Overall, the hotel was good, but there is still room for improvement.

It would be better if the hotel had a swimming pool for guests to enjoy, especially since it’s not directly facing the sea and the beach nearby is in a cove. These facilities would make the stay more fun and relaxing, especially for families.

The buffet breakfast also didn’t have many choices, which was a bit disappointing. More variety would make the meal more enjoyable.

On the bright side, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, which made our stay more pleasant.

name: AHMAD SHAKUR JAMALUDIN
text:
I stayed at this chalet from October 13 to 17, 2025. The room was decent, but the air conditioning in the living area didn’t work properly. The floor looked old, and the design felt outdated. The breakfast menu was okay, though the selection was quite limited. Overall, the chalet was just average for me.

I also stayed in a villa for one night. The villa had one bedroom, but it was quite small and felt cramped with two single beds. In the living area, there was one queen bed. The villa had two bathrooms — one inside the bedroom and another in the living area, which included a bathtub. It also featured a balcony facing the sea, offering a beautiful and peaceful view with the relaxing sound of the waves. The breakfast menu for the villa stay was fantastic, with a wide variety of dishes from Western to local cuisine.

text: Nice laid back chalet that has a private entrance to the beach (80-100m). The chalet comes with a twin or double bed in the room plus a small living area. The top cushion can be removed to spread across the floor but it's not a uniform mattress. However, if on can rough it out, you still can make do..Toilet has a partition which is a good design.Breakfast buffet is the usual spread. Not exceptional but functional to start the day. The beach activities amenities are good with a wash area before U enter the compound. There's also many water cooler for use. Service is definitely a plus overall with great staff!

name: Daniel Themudu
text:
Decent facility - World Class Employees!
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I brought my corporate clients here for a team building program from 24–26 September, and to be honest, my initial impression wasn’t too high. Being a government-owned hotel, I expected “average and below standard.”

But Royal Chulan Cherating Chalets absolutely proved me wrong. From the moment we arrived, the team carried themselves with such professionalism, warmth, and pride—it turned what I thought would be a normal stay into a truly memorable experience.

Special shout-outs:
•	Faiza (Front Office): Ensured every single pre-arrangement was met exactly as discussed. Smooth, efficient, and reliable.
•	Ainnur (Sales): Incredible attention to detail and fantastic service from start to finish.
•	Shah, Posa & Ridwan (Safety & Front Office): Thank you for your kindness and for keeping our campfire woods dry despite the heavy rain. And Jacky—walking 60 meters just to check on us and ensuring the buggy arrived on time… that’s next-level service.
•	Alif & Hanafiz (Maintenance): Made sure the LED TV and sound system worked flawlessly, turning our indoor sessions into something special.
•	F&B Team: Young, energetic Gen Z, yet their attentiveness and service quality are among the BEST I’ve experienced in Malaysia.
•	Front Office Team: Shah, Suraya, the cheerful young lady with braces, and the rest—you made every interaction a joy.
•	Housekeeping Kakak-kakak: Other hotels in Malaysia should benchmark your standards. Rooms were immaculate, and the care you put in is simply world-class.

Royal Chulan Cherating Chalets, you’ve set a new benchmark for what a hotel stay should feel like. This isn’t just hospitality—it’s heartfelt service. Truly a hidden gem on the East Coast. 🌊✨

Regards
Daniel Themudu
Performigo Academy

See you all soon end of october Again!!
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Wai Yin Lai
text:
We stayed 5 nights in the Family Villa. The location and views were great. However the villa configuration was disappointing with the King bed in the living space. Further details below.
On the website specific to Cherating branch, the facilities selection actually took us to the KL branch. I acknowledge I should have looked more carefully but felt a little deceived thinking it had a great gym/fitness centre which is important to our family.
We were disappointed too that the hotel did not serve alcohol. I think this needs to be clearly stated on the website.
Slippery sections of tiles around pool area was dangerous - I slipped and fell.

name: Yura hasan
text:
I recently stayed at Royal Chulan Chalet and overall, it was an okay experience. The place itself was nice, but I do want to point out a major thing I wasn’t expecting—there’s no swimming pool at the chalet. If you want to swim, you have to head up to Royal Chulan Villa on the hill, and even then, the staff told me you’d need to pay extra to use the pool.
This left me really puzzled. The Chalet and Villa are both under the Royal Chulan name, yet there’s such a big difference in facilities. I get that the chalet is cheaper, but it seems a bit off to not have basic amenities like a pool, especially when you’re already paying a decent price for your stay. If they want to keep the Chalet separate from the Villa, they should at least add a pool at the Chalet. It would make a big difference.
On the bright side, the food was fantastic! Everything I tried was delicious, and that definitely made up for some of the other quirks.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

text: As I have walking difficulties, the restaurant manager is Mr Rohim is quick to offer help. He helps to get and serve me food and drinks at the restaurant morning breakfast hours. I was delighted   by the exceptional good service.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Nick Dass
text:
I spent a few days at Royale Chulan Penang and it was an amazing experience overall. While the hotel may look a bit old at first glance, it has a timeless, classic charm that grows on you. The atmosphere was calm and welcoming, and the service truly stood out.

A special shoutout to Selva, who went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable at the pool and gym areas. He was incredibly friendly, attentive, and just a genuinely great person to talk to. His warm hospitality really added a personal touch to my stay and made me feel well taken care of. Thanks to him, I had a really memorable experience at the hotel. Would definitely recommend Royale Chulan to anyone visiting Penang!
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: Nice n friendly staff and is god location for close to all the tourists area.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: 酒店很大间，地理位置很好，门口就有中国银行，取现十分方便。但装修不是很新，酒店应该有些年份的了。早餐品种多，但适合华人的不多😅，工作人员都很热情，至少对我们华人很热情。

text: Have a pleasant stay, everything was nice, too bad there is no gym or swimming pool.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Oliver Hermann
text: Wir waren dort für 2 Tage in der Ocean Suite mit Balkon untergebracht . Bei booking.com wird es als 5 Sterne Hotel angegeben. Die ganze Anlage ist schon sehr "abgerockt". Die einstmals wohl sehr schönen Zimmer haben schwere Abnutzungserscheinungen an der Decke, dem Boden und den Wänden. Die Lage ist phänomenal! Man schaut aus dem Fenster und sieht den Pool und direkt dahinter den Strand mit dem Meer, genial. Der Pool selber hat seine besten Jahre auch hinter sich. An vielen Ecken und Enden lösen sich kleine Mosaikfliesen und die Liegen bringen keinen großen Komfort, sie sollten besser mal ausgetauscht werden. Das Personal ist sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Beim Frühstück werden einheimische Dinge aber auch frisch zubereitete Eierspeisen, Toast und Croissants gereicht. Abends kann man a la Carte oder vom Buffet wählen. Das Essen dort ist lecker.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Mohd Shukri Mokhtar
text:
WHERE HOSPITALITY SUPERSEDED FACILITIES

The buggy service is kinda turn-off. After long hours drive here, It’s the first thing we hv to face once we arrived at the car park (visitor cannot bring up car to the lobby area). we hv to wait bout half n hour for the buggy.

But after 4 days here, the hospitality we received from the staffs totally overcome the day 1 buggy blunder. The buggy complaint wasn’t meant for the staffs actually, it’s for the hotel management to buy more buggies!
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Graeme Fitzpatrick
text: Great location at Cherating, what a beautiful spot.  Off the beaten track but good clean hotel and rooms, great views and good breakfast.  Just stayed the one night but very glad we did get to see the local area. The hotel is fine, rooms a little old but still in good shape & you are right on the beach.

text: Perfect Location
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Iman Iman
text:
Stayed in Villa 116 for 4 days and 3 nights for a staycation. Great location, but old facilities.

Pros
- Beautiful view, easy access to a clean and amazing beach.
- Walkable to many activities nearby like firefly cruise and viral cafes.
- Appreciate housekeeping; clean, polite and provided my extra requests.
- Receptionist was helpful and answered all my questions every day.

Cons
- Floor creaks loudly with EVERY step. I woke up my friend in the middle of the night just to go to the bathroom.
- Outdoor bathroom bathtub has chipped off paint, and the drain cannot fully close, so water cannot fill up. Basically, the bathtub useless and unusable.
- Male staff made several thoughtless comments that stuck with me.
1. "Memang sengaja booking hari Isnin ke?" - obviously, takkan lah I ACCIDENTALLY booked 🙄 there are better ways to inform me that many shops/attractions are closed in the early week. Maybe focus on what I CAN do instead of telling me I've basically wasted my time and money booking on a Monday?
2. I booked a firefly cruise independently, the second trip, and was quite happy when I got back. Then a staff member decided to make an unsolicited opinion, "Rugi lah, rugi. Patutnya book firefly cruise dengan hotel. (Proceeds to talk bad about the organizer I booked the cruise with, compared to the one the hotel would've booked for me)." - Do I need to state how rude this is? I just got back from my trip and I felt good. My happy mood was ruined after hearing this. What was the point of saying all that?

I came to splurge on a quiet and comfortable staycation. Instead, I felt uneasy because as a young woman, the hotel's predominantly male staff thinks it's appropriate to make comments I didn't ask for as though I was their family member. Additionally, the villa I got was ageing and not fitting for the 3k price tag.

Would love to visit Cherating again but I won't make a second visit to Royal Chulan nor will I be recommending it to anybody I know.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Teletubbies Cutie
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Ahmad Wira
text: The place has aged but they are maintaining it well with very good service. Arrangement with Ariff for activities was seamless and he made sure all the planned activities went well. A great spot for a family getaway.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Fatini Fauzi
text:
Pros - location wise, it is good
Cons - the breakfast is the most disappointing. If you’ve seen the breakfast area vs the number of rooms they have here, it is very disproportionate

By 8am you arrive, you have to wait for someone to leave the table before being seated. By the time we came back from getting coffee from a nearby store, the PIC just smiled and said, another 10mins. By 8.50am we got the table, the food is mostly gone. Roti canai left the most ugly looking ones, condiments of porridge is finished, even the porridge itself is finished. The blue nasi lemak, each customers could only take 1 little spoon portion per person. What is this level of service? I’m not sure, this is the start of the end of royale chulan in cherating i guess
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Yi Yang
text: Royale Chulan Seremban is a hidden gem that truly represents Malaysian hospitality at its finest. The hotel offers excellent facilities, from clean, spacious rooms to a relaxing pool and gym area. The service is warm and attentive, making every guest feel valued. Their food is a highlight—beautifully presented with authentic Malaysian flavours that showcase our rich cultural heritage. Located conveniently with easy access and plenty of free parking, it’s perfect for both quick getaways and longer stays. Highly recommended for anyone looking for comfort, culture, and great service all in one place!

name: Trip.com Member
text: We had a pleasant 2D1N stay at this hotel. The location is excellent—very near the MRT, which made it super convenient for us to get around using public transport. The room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast provided was up to standard for a 4-star hotel.One thing to note: the car park is mentioned as RM4 per entry, but we were charged RM8 for our stay even though we didn’t drive out during the time we were there. It seems the rate is RM4 per day rather than per entry, which is still reasonable.Overall, it was a good stay with great value and convenience. Would recommend for anyone looking to explore the city using public transport!

name: jackie wui
text:
Perfect location for multiple activities. Explored the 3 or 4 café just a few steps from hotel. Mangrove tour and firefly tour jetty is just ~1km along the same street. Short 10-15 min drive to Chukai or the turtle watching location. Not forgetting hotel is by the beach.

Room may not be brand new but it is clean and dust free.

Secured carpark. Entrance is manned.

Best choice for travellers with activities mentioned above. If one is looking solely for rest & relax i.e. just stay put in resort with pool and beach, stay their other property next door, the Villa.

name: Nurul Nadiah Abdul Rahman
text:
Great Location, Disappointing Facilities.

I stayed in the Family Villa. The beach is truly beautiful, and the villa is comfortable, although it is showing signs of age. The bathtub was stained yellow, which made it uncomfortable to use. For the price charged, the facilities should be upgraded — or the rates adjusted accordingly.

The swimming pool was unfortunately very dirty, which made it unpleasant to use.

Breakfast, which was mainly local dishes, was disappointing. Although it is stated to start at 7:00 am, nothing was ready on time. I had to wait for nasi dagang until 8:13 am, and the taste was not satisfactory.

The beach area has no seating or umbrellas provided for guests, which was surprising for a resort of this level. Providing these basic facilities would greatly improve the guest experience.

Overall, the location and view are lovely, but the value for money is not there. Improvements in cleanliness, facilities, and service timing are needed.

Breakfast spread was varied & suited my taste well. The staffs are also friendly & helpful. Although it was a little difficult to get e-hailing vehicles like Grab to go to my meeting venue.Overall, a stay worth remembering & repeating

name: Alec Lim
text:
Location of this hotel is very good. Connected to the Mutiara Damansara MRT station n walking distance to Curve area & IPC so plenty of shopping opportunities and food options.
Hotel itself is very old and signs of wear is every where. Reasonably maintained. Room is very large and even with extra bed, there is sufficient room to walk about.
Customer service is poor. Starting with reception where I find the command of English lacking. We stayed 3 nights and I needed an extra bed, strangely initially charged for extra bed for a night only. When I inquired about this, the staff seemed bewildered. Eventually paid for the 2 other nights. When the bed was delivered, you would expect that additional towels and such would also be given. Had to ask for 2 of the 3 days we were here. They got it right only on the last night.
We had breakfast included... mediocre standards. First time in any hotel with live station that sunny side eggs were not sunny but burnt.
Will likely stay again as location and room size is key but won't take the breakfast as there are options with nearby eateries.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

text: Perfect
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: I had quite an adventure in a spacious room that, while a bit dated in style, offered some fantastic highlights! The coziness of the space was undeniable, even though the carpet could use a little TLC. I had a bit of fun improvising a way to keep the water in the bathtub since the stopper wasn’t working, but at least the water heater was blazing hot—perfect for a relaxing soak!The bed had its quirks; you could definitely feel the springs, which added a bit of character to the experience. But let me tell you, the view from the window was absolutely stunning, and everything worked perfectly there! They provided a great selection of tea and coffee, just enough to get my day started right.Now, let’s talk about the pool—it was a total highlight! The children’s pool had warm water, making it a great spot to splash around, and there was even a fun kids' corner for some extra entertainment! I can definitely see myself returning the next time I'm in the Seremban area; it’s super convenient for my travels.Breakfast? It was decent and quick, perfect for those on the go. Overall, it was a delightful stay, and I can’t wait for my next visit!

name: lyn Beezkut
text:
Had a truly pleasant and enjoyable stay with my family! The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive—special mention to Ms. Faizah at the front desk who made us feel very welcome. Housekeeping and restaurant services were top-notch, everything was clean and well taken care of.

The pools were amazing, especially for kids—they loved the water slide, and the jacuzzi was perfect for the adults to relax. The location is super convenient, close to everything we needed. Parking was also hassle-free and free for guests, which was a big plus.

Highly recommend this hotel for families. We had a great time and would definitely return!

The food was very good overall, both in the buffet, the Chinese restaurant, and when dining a la carte.  Would stay here again if visiting Seremban.

name: weiminn2018
text: A friend had advised us to stay at this Cherating villa 2 yrs ago and only recently we had the  opportunity to stay there..||Made up of villas and 6-8 ocean view rooms, set on a hillside to the north of the Cherating beach. Well maintained (not all East Coast hotels are)  and with a luxurious finish turned out to be a comfortable stay.  The family villa is laid out rather uniquely,  the main master bedroom is a large king sized bed with a living area set up between the bed and the balcony.  This living area is where we spent most of our time, chatting, drinking coffee and snacking.  The other bedroom has a separate entrance to one end of the living area, with a door and it opens up to a smaller room with 2 single beds.  The good thing is that the master bedroom has a bigger toilet/shower with a jacuzzi,  and the smaller 2 bed room has a WC and shower.  That mkes it a villa for a very comfortable stay for 4 adults.||Ocean rooms are built beside the pool,  next level up are the family villas and further up the suite- villas.  ||Transport by buggy is provided FOC and all you need is a call and the buggy appears within 5 min. ||We enjoyed the time in the living area and on the balcony watching the sun rise from one corner of the beach and the dusk conditions over the beach.  The beach in front of RC is unique as there is a large sand bar towards the sea, followed in wards by a calm pond and then the beach.  Very good for young children to play away from the breakers.||Our villa came with breakfast and contrary to some reviews, it was a very good breakfast.  Breads, cereals, fruits, hot dishes like nasi lemak with condiments, noodles with soup, prata, and our favourite was their turmeric fried chicken.  Accompany this were fruit juices and coffee/tea service from fresh coffee machines.  Live stations prepared eggs any way you want and service was excellent.||For outside meals, you may wish to walk to the south,towards the main Cherating beach for a few beach restaurants serving the public.||Agro||We planned to stay at Raub and getting a good hotel was a challenge as there were so few.  We decided on this hotel because it was new, full time concierge and an ELEVATOR  .  the other hotels did not.||Rooms were functional, clean, all things worked, toilet and shower clean and towels provided.  My only complaint is that the shower rail was up but  missing the shower curtains.||No breakfast but there are coffee shops nearby for your morning brew.||Anika||Recently renovated with upgraded carpets and flooring - appears better than the last time we stayed,  or was it our opting for an upgrade from a standard room.||Clean rooms, full complement of towels, and comfortable beds smack in the middle of town.  This is our third time staying there.|
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: moshie LY
text:
Royal Chulan Cherating, Family Villa — Superb & Worth Every Second! 💙

First time here and totally impressed! From the magnificent beach view, comfy rooms, delicious food — to the genuinely kind and helpful staff, everything was just amazing.

Special shoutout to Abang Hadi at the pool area — such a gem! He made my stay so much easier by sharing all the info on nearby restaurants and fun activities around. Friendly, attentive, and penuh senyuman. Thank you, Abang Hadi! 🙌

Terima kasih Royal Chulan Cherating — you’ve won our hearts. Till we meet again! 💫🌊

name: HE1974AD
text: The Royale Chulan Seremban has clearly seen better days. While the staff remain incredibly friendly, providing the warm hospitality Malaysia is known for, the overall state of the hotel is a major letdown. Management has severely neglected maintenance and modernization, leaving guests to deal with dust, mold, and outdated infrastructure.||||This hotel was once a Hilton, yet it seems little has changed since those days—except for the decline in upkeep. It’s evident that since Seremban is not a major tourist hub, little effort is made to maintain or improve the property. Unfortunately, this does not reflect the true standard of Malaysian hospitality.||||What makes it even worse is the price. For the same rates, you could stay in a well-maintained international hotel in Kuala Lumpur, making the value here extremely poor. Guests and Malaysia as a whole deserve better. Management should step up and restore this hotel to a level worthy of its name.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Road04863242275
text: We had a lovely stay at Royale Chulan Cherating as a family with young children and elderly parents. We booked two ground floor rooms for easy access, which was really convenient. Prior to our trip, we contacted the hotel for a surprise birthday arrangement—and they went above and beyond! They allowed us to celebrate at Villa Café, a beautiful restaurant with stunning sea views. It made the occasion truly special.||All the staff were warm, friendly, and very helpful throughout our stay. One suggestion for improvement: it would be great if the hotel could offer luggage delivery service to the rooms, especially for families with kids or elderly guests. Carrying bags to the chalet can be quite a hassle, especially with the hilly layout. This small service would really add convenience—and it’s also a nice opportunity for staff to earn tips.||The villa is located on a cliff edge, offering breathtaking views, while our chalet (a two-floor apartment-style block) was located lower down the hill. Walking to the villa can be steep, so it’s best to take the shuttle provided by the hotel.||The chalet we stayed in had direct access to a private beach—just a few steps away, which was perfect for the kids! Tip: choose a room facing the playground as it’s closest to the beach access. The beach is great for surfing too. Just note that monsoon season (November to February) can bring frequent rain and strong winds, but we still thoroughly enjoyed our stay despite the weather.||The rooms are spacious and clean—each chalet can comfortably fit four adults. The sofa bed is a bit firm, so bringing an extra mattress might help for better comfort. Overall, this is a peaceful and affordable place to relax, with beautiful nature all around. Highly recommended for families!
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: I initially booked one night and later added another night. Upon check-in, I requested to merge both bookings since the second night followed directly after the first. However, the receptionist refused, citing company policy that doesn’t allow guests to check in for two separate bookings with different dates at once.This was extremely inconvenient, especially for a business traveler like me. Having to return the next day just to check in again added unnecessary hassle to an already tiring trip. The experience was frustrating and did not make my stay pleasant.I won’t be returning to this hotel or its chain. Goodbye!

text: 这家酒店地理位置不错，出行方便，是一家五星级酒店，设施齐全。早餐种类丰富，能满足不同口味的需求。然而，酒店整体较为老旧，房间和公共区域的设施都有些陈旧，缺乏翻新。卫生状况一般，清洁度有待提升，尤其是房间的细节清洁需要加强。服务态度尚可，但整体体验与五星级标准相比稍显不足。如果对设施新颖度和卫生要求较高，可能需要考虑其他选择。总体而言，性价比一般，适合短期入住。

name: Hartmut Erbel
text:
Disappointing Neglect of a Once-Grand Hotel

The Royale Chulan Seremban has clearly seen better days. While the staff remain incredibly friendly, providing the warm hospitality Malaysia is known for, the overall state of the hotel is a major letdown. Management has severely neglected maintenance and modernization, leaving guests to deal with dust, mold, and outdated infrastructure.

This hotel was once a Hilton, yet it seems little has changed since those days—except for the decline in upkeep. It’s evident that since Seremban is not a major tourist hub, little effort is made to maintain or improve the property. Unfortunately, this does not reflect the true standard of Malaysian hospitality.

What makes it even worse is the price. For the same rates, you could stay in a well-maintained international hotel in Kuala Lumpur, making the value here extremely poor. Guests and Malaysia as a whole deserve better. Management should step up and restore this hotel to a level worthy of its name.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: michael choo
text:
A nice small hotel that is old and dated. The design is more of the nineties.

The restaurant is facing the pool and the pool is very well designed and is not the conventional square lap pool but with waterfalls.

The hi- tea buffet offers the raya spread of malay cuisines to celebrate the occasion.

The beef rendang was good but very spicy. The chicken rendang was also good. The mutton was also tasty but slightly tough.

The battered fish and spaghetti was average and could do better.

They have a range of salad vegetables for your choosing and individual preferences.

The cooked Cauliflower and broccoli was okay.

The desserts consisted of various local kuih, fruits, ice kacang and ice cream. Many choices for dessert lovers. The desserts were not the best but good enough.

They have teh tarik, black tea and black coffee  as well to wash your pallette.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Dominic
text: Checking in was a breeze, and the staffs were very helpful in guiding me where to park my big bike. A staff member even went to the basement carpark to wait for me just to show me the special spot to park. The room is huge, retro, and well maintained with all the necessities. Everything was working perfectly even though the system was old skool, just the way I like it. Worth the money spent.

Pleasantly surprised with the chalet (note this is not the villas). The entrance, the front desk and the cafe was nothing to shout about. It was simple and clean. That's it.
However I really like the room, for the price we paid (250+ with breakfast) it's really value for money. The room have separate living area with two seater sofa, TV, small fridge and the usual mineral water and instant coffee. Then you have your bedroom with queen size bed and a separate toilet that you can access from living area or bedroom. Water heater, iron and ironing board also being provided.
Easy access to the beach is a plus point for me. Too bad there are no swimming pool.

name: Harpreet Singh
text:
We stayed for two nights and had a very pleasant experience overall. The hotel is exceptionally clean, both inside and out, and has a dashing appearance. The service was excellent, with well-mannered and attentive staff. The buffet offered a nice variety of food, and the location was perfect—quiet, peaceful, and beautiful, especially in the evenings during the weekend.

Our room was spacious and clean, equipped with all the basic facilities we needed. However, there was quite a bit of furniture, which made the space feel an extra burden Reducing some of the furniture could provide more room, especially for families with kids.

The lifts were very efficient—hardly any wait time, usually less than 15 seconds. We stayed on a non-smoking floor, and the entire hotel maintained a clean and fresh environment. Smokers are required to move outside the lobby to designated areas, which is a good practice. However, smoking in front of the hotel’s main entrance doesn’t reflect well on the hotel’s image, so it might be better to enforce the designated smoking areas more strictly.

The parking arrangement was manageable. Additionally, it might be helpful to modernize the swimming pool area for better experience, particularly for children, and to provide more coverage from the sun. This is just a friendly suggestion to enhance the experience further.

Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay. The food, peaceful environment, and ability to work comfortably made it a great experience. We would happily return and recommend this hotel to others.
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

name: Trip.com Member
text: The room is spacious and clean. Breakfast very nice
title: Royale Chulan Seremban

Dead ants fell off the ceiling, bath towel has stains and furnitures were old, wear and tear not fixed.  Swimming pool is not well maintained. Broken tiles and full of sand on the ground. Resting chairs are also broken. Not forgetting room service took 45 mins for order of lekur and ice cream.  It would have been cheaper and faster to order through Grab.

If the room rate was 500rm, I would understand. But for a villa to charge more than 1K with such experience, you may not have guest coming back.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member

name: Trip.com Member
text: I recently stayed at this hotel, and unfortunately, my experience was far from ideal. The air conditioning in my room was malfunctioning, leaving the room uncomfortably warm throughout my stay. On top of that, there were multiple power outages during my visit, causing significant inconvenience. These basic amenities are crucial for a comfortable stay, and the lack of both was extremely frustrating. I hope the hotel addresses these issues for future guests.

But the sofa in the room sinks to the floor so we have to ask for 4 extra pillows to sit on. They should throw the sofa away as junk, quite frankly. The beach was quiet and nice. Staff service was good.

name: Trip.com Member
text: The staff are friendly and always smile. the lobby also beautiful and smell good, i like it. But when i arrived at the room, there was a dirty plate in front my door, do i supposed to see that during my arrival?In addition, the room i get was not complete with amenities. There was no stirrer to stir the coffee and no bathrobe to relax after taking bath. This is 5 star hotel and you dont have such basic things? And for water, you should prepare mineral water instead of drinking water. The furniture inaide the room also look old.And the breakfast have a lot of variety. I appreciate it, but the taste of food is so-so. The nasi lemak sambal taste weird. Also the noodle soup not prepare shredded chicken. Its not complete. only omelette, pancake and roti canai are delicious. And the last, the toilet at the lobby was dirty like it is not 5 star hotel.In conclusion, i rate this hotel as so-so because it not fulfill my expectations as 5 star hotel.

name: Hadi Dehghanpour Farashah
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location is very good, in walking distance to main city attraction, we had the view to Petronas twin towers from our room. MRT station is few steps away from the hotel entrance. The rooms are big enough, silent and comfort. The breakfast diversity is not perfect. You cannot find Mediterranean and Middle East tastes. And one more thing: the rooms are not voice proof. Overall, the Hotel satisfies you.

name: Wietse van Dijk
text: Fijn hotel op perfecte lokatie. Je loopt zo naar het Pavilion winkelcentrum (gebruik de loopbrug via het Banyan Tree hotel) en daarachter Bukit Bintang. Ook loop je in 15min naar het KLCC park. Het hotel is zeer ruim opgezet en heeft een groot zwembad.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: YorksPu
text: Arrived here having arrived by road from Melaka.||Impressive, if slightly old-fashioned lobby - and quickly checked in by reception. Up to the fourth floor to room 423. Our hearts sank when we saw the building site next door! But in all honesty we weren’t disturbed by it and the construction workers knocked off at 8pm and didn’t restart until 8am, so no big deal. ||Our room turned out to be the biggest one we had on our trip. Large bathroom/dressing area, kitchen area with fridge and a small freezer compartment, microwave, electric 2-ring hob, kettle with tea & coffee, sink, kitchen cupboards. But note - no crockery, cutlery or pans, or washing-up liquid or T-towels. Just 2 mugs for tea - no glasses either! At most you can re-heat a takeaway.||Large bedroom with table & chairs, desk & chair and a sofa. Bed was comfortable. Two free to use safety deposit boxes and two wardrobes plus drawers. WiFi worked well. ||Now, have to be honest and say the hotel could do with being completely refurbished. It’s very old-fashioned and rather tatty in places. Only one electrical socket worked in our room and some overhead lights didn’t work. The toilet door didn’t close either! All that being said, it was comfortable and clean and the staff were all lovely. It’s also a low-rise building, with a lot of character and an oasis in the hustle and bustle of KL, and a change from the ever present soulless skyscrapers. ||On to breakfast. An absolute feast, catering for all tastes, Indian, Chinese, Western- really sumptuous and good quality. ||We had a brief look at the swimming pool which although we didn’t have time to use, was a great addition.||Close to Conley MRT and the Pavilion mall. The latter of which has a wonderful food court in the basement- recommended. ||So, despite the need for refurbishment, we really liked this hotel. As I say, it is an oasis in the concrete jungle of central KL.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

name: Dennis
text: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Fabulous breakfast and efficient, friendly staff. The room was a good size and had all the amenities we needed. Some areas could do with some TLC, but overall, we were satisfied.
title: Royale Chulan Kuala Lumpur

Location is just opposite lake garden so its nice and quiet but not too far from town.||All in all, highly recommended hotel in seremban!

name: YiLong
text:
Royale Chulan Damansara is in a convenient location, just a 5-minute walk from a nearby mall. While the dining options are somewhat limited due to the office area setting, the hotel offers easy access to other locations. One Utama Shopping Mall, which has a wider variety of options, is only a 10-minute drive away.

The property shows signs of aging and could benefit from better maintenance to fully meet a four-star standard. However, the service is excellent, with staff who are polite, attentive, and engaging.

This is the first hotel i stayed in Malaysia needs to pay car park.

name: lil tweet
text:
First of all, there are 2 Royale Chulan hotels. This one which is called Royale Chulan Damansara is linked to the MRT whilst Royale Chulan The Curve is located within The Curve mall.

(No, it's not an error on Google Maps).

Royale Chulan Damansara looks like it's been around a while. The room is comfortably decorated, but it does look like it needs to be refurbished soon.

There are a few lifts to get to the guest room floors. While I was there, I could go from the carpark at B1 directly to Level 4 - without using the guest key card.

Alhamdulilah. team kami berbuka di royale chulan sebagai ganti menu bersahur hospital. layan mereka seadanya jangan ikot taraf. tq.

text:
Reviewing this few weeks late. The villa is spacious, got beach view, toilet were big. We asked for baby cot, and we got it though it depends on availability.

Lots of parking but need to take buggy to go to the villas. From villas , also need to take buggy to go to pool/breakfast. Can walk too but the buggy is very efficient.

Breakfast is just so so. Ordered room service for dinner both nights we were there. The portion is good, taste ok, price is standard hotel price.

Beach is very near, such an experience to see people surf in malaysia. Came here for my daughter’s birthday. We got a mini birthday cake. It was thoughtfull we love it. No regret. The staffs were all so good.

The only thing is quite difficult to find nearby restaurants that can be accessed by walking distance.

name: Trip.com Member

Restaurant is good and spacious too, 20% discount very worth on top of delicious food. Location is very central, near prima mall and seremban gate way. Not a far drive from good food places and the other malls Palm Mall and Aeon mall. Staff were very hospitable, courteous and kind. Best hotel in Seremban for me, I will definitely come back when I come here to visit family.

name: C S
text:
Hotel is near prima mall. Short drive to Seremban gateway too. Room is quite spacious. Bathroom too with bathtub. Hotel is a bit old but room is still clean. I think it’s the best one in Seremban, more consistent than the others hence why I chose this place. Hospitality and service is good. Pool is nice, gym is not small but not big, equipment is well maintained and clean too.

I’m impressed the whole set is provided. Some Malaysia hotels don’t give conditioner and toothbrush set and slippers, but this one gave all also with shower cap.

name: Irene Lee
text:
Staying at this hotel during my Chinese New Year trip to Seremban, and I was thoroughly impressed with the warm hospitality.

From the moment we arrived, the hotel staffs welcome us a lot. Besides, mandarin oranges, angpows, and festive cookies provided in our room. These little touches really enhanced the festive spirit and made our stay feel extra special.

The service was excellent, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable and memorable experience.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a welcoming and festive atmosphere during the holiday season!

name: Hana
text:
I had a wonderful staycation at RCCV, and I absolutely loved my Family Villa room. The view from my villa was spectacular. I could enjoy the ocean view right from my bed. Having meals and chatting with my family on the balcony was a delight.
The private beach was my favorite spot even before RC existed. I also loved their pool, where I could enjoy the beach view while swimming. Since it's still monsoon season, I could watch people surfing, which was quite enjoyable.
The breakfast spread was impressive, with a wide variety of choices from local to western selections. The coffee was excellent, and my daughter particularly enjoyed the yogurt and chef's pasta. It was delicious.
My room was clean and spacious, with great water pressure and a jacuzzi in the main bathroom. I appreciated the thoughtful touch like the prayer mat for Muslim guests.
A big thank you to Mr. Faiza Musa for assisting with the booking. The check-in and check-out process was smooth. I will definitely return with my family.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: Nice quiet place. Limited food amenities but service is excellent.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: Pictures of the villa from the web looked picture perfect, moreover with the high rating, but it was far from reality. When priced over RM500 per night for the cheapest room , 1 would expect a certain level of standard. Upon check in, I didn't feel welcomed at the reception, not even a hi lol. The security and the buggy guy were more welcoming and sincere. When entering the room, I was shocked to see the flooring in utter dismay, it was scratched left right center, nobody felt the need to polish it?  AC was visibly dirty, had a slight tinge of musky smell, when was the last servicing done? Ceiling was stained, wall paper was peeling/ bubbling and sofa had a ironing burnt mark LOL. The toilet still had sand at the corners of the floor! Where the heck is the QC and maintenance? TV channels had nothing to watch either. If u look closely at the pictures I've taken, I also noticed the edges of the tiling... Just shows the poor QC and mindset the management or employees have there. Kids pool was closed throughout our stay, bummer. Apparently it was spoiled and in need of repairs. Not sure how long it's been down. Basically there's nothing much for families with kids to do here other than the beach. Beach access wise, the cement stairs to the Beach split into 2... Management waiting for accidents to happen to guests before action is taken? Food wise was ok but not extensive enough. Nothing great either. Overall this wasn't a good experience, in fact it's utterly disappointing. For the price there are definitely better resorts along the cherating kuantan coast. As a shareholder of Boustead, this is very concerning. I would not recommend to family and friends.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

title: Royale Chulan The Curve

name: Cassandra Kby
text:
What I like:
1) The location is superb — close to the MRT, One Utama, Ikano, IKEA, and The Curve.

2) Breakfast was good, and my favourite part was the live station serving omelettes and scrambled eggs. This is a must-have for any hotel breakfast.

3) The room was spacious. Although the wallpaper and furniture could use some refurbishment, I liked the creamy-white colour scheme. The solid wood doors and built-in wardrobe gave a quality feel.

What I dislike:
1) Some of the staff seemed to have difficulty understanding English, perhaps because many of them were foreigners.

2) It was a bit noisy at night. I’m not entirely sure what the sound was, but it resembled a pumping noise.

Overall:
For me, the hotel offered reasonable value for the price I paid. Thank you.
title: Royale Chulan The Curve

name: tsn WONDER
text:
Just tried the roadside hawker stall at Royal Chulan and it’s definitely worth a stop!

Their Nasi Kukus Chicken is only RM10 and comes in a generous portion – the chicken is crunchy, fragrant, and super satisfying. I also tried the Nasi Ayam Gepuk (RM15) – not bad at all! The fried tempeh is aromatic, and the tauhu is perfectly done – crunchy outside, soft inside.

A must-try is their sambal – it really ties everything together. What I love most is that all the chicken is fried fresh only after you order, so it stays juicy and flavorful.

Even their drinks impressed me – the syrup is thick, sweet, and fragrant. Simple but very shiok! Add on fried Kubis only RM2!

Overall, great taste, freshly prepared, and good value for money. Will definitely come back again!

name: Trip.com Member
text: 8.4“Great Stay”We had an amazing stay even though its just for a night. Staff was friendly & really accommodating. We booked a total of 9 rooms. Only downside is its not meant for elderly people. Cause you need to walk up and down the stairs to go to the beach, restaurant & pool. Lucky the buggy able to pick us up from the villa down to restaurant. But still need to walk up and down a few stairs. The view was amazing. Dinner at restaurant was great. Just that waiting to wait for our dinner was close to an hour. Should improve on that. Some of our family members did a room service also waited close to an hour for the food. If you find the food costly, can always book grabfood or get out of the villa & drive around the area look for restaurants. Room and view was amazing! We loved our stay!

Waited for an hour for lunch when there was no one else in the restaurant, and when the food eventually came, it was cold and very average. Another example of why Malaysia will never match their neighbours for hospitality.  Just get the basics right first. It's a mindset...no excuses.

name: Dewithraa Siva
text:
Two days ago, I had the privilege of coordinating our school event at Royale Chulan Damansara, Mutiara Ballroom. I must say, the food served for the VIP (dome) and the buffet for the guests was absolutely delicious. The mushroom soup with bread was definitely the highlight – it tasted so good!

As the coordinator for this event, I received a lot of positive feedback from both teachers and parents, which was truly gratifying. I would like to give special thanks to Mr. Nozrin, the Sales Manager, who was incredibly helpful throughout the entire process. It was a pleasure working with him. Whenever there was a technical issue, he quickly addressed and resolved it, ensuring the event ran smoothly.

I also want to express my appreciation for their staff, Ms. Fiona and Mr. Joe. They were both very helpful, especially when it came to assisting with the ballroom arrangement. They listened attentively to our requirements and offered helpful suggestions based on their company's policies. Their professionalism and willingness to go the extra mile were much appreciated.

While no event is ever without its flaws, and it's impossible to please everyone, the overall experience was positive. We truly felt supported by the Royale Chulan team, and our school management was very happy with how everything turned out.

Thank you to the entire team for your hard work and dedication!
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Sandra Wang
text:
Disappointing Experience – Definitely Not 4-Star Standard

We had a very disappointing stay at this hotel. While it’s advertised as a 4-star property, the room condition was far from that. The facilities are outdated, and the room was not properly cleaned — definitely not what you’d expect from a hotel of this rating.

The swimming pool was closed temporarily, but there was no prior notice on the website or during booking. We only found out upon check-in, which felt very misleading.

When we mentioned our disappointment to the manager, as a way to “upgrade” us, he put us to a worse room which out to be facing the back of another building with large exhaust fans running non-stop. The noise was extremely loud, making it hard to sleep. The balcony area was also dirty and covered in pigeon droppings — completely unacceptable.

避雷！整个经历非常糟糕，在酒店改善设施和服务态度之前，绝不推荐入住。 完全影响度假心情。

强烈推荐隔壁的The Prestige Hotel Penang! Highly recommend The Prestige Hotel Penang next door — a true 5-star experience. Rooms are clean and modern, service is profession.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: K T
text:
Third stay at this hotel! Bed was comfy and view of pool and sea was good. Amenities in rooms were well thought out, except the towel rack at the sink. There is a move towards sustainability from previous stays. Breakfast spread was great and tasty.

Housekeeping was attentive and helpful to our needs. Water was provided sufficiently. Staff were courteous and attentive, especially those in the banquet and breakfast halls.

Highlights are
1. Walkable to many places in Georgetown, jetties (can go running/catch sunrise since you live so near), Armenian streets, monuments, museums, etc
2. Yummy food right at the doorstep or across the road (NORM Cafe, 2 frenchies, food court!)
3. Short drive from the malls (Gurney, TOP)
4. Feels like a safe and quiet neighborhood

Would be great if:
1. Opening time for door towards jetty side/chocolate shop could be made known.
2. Have some rack for us to put up our swim in the bath.
3. Remove the additional soaps in bottles since there is already some in the bath,
4. Provide liquid hand soap in press bottles so we do need to go into bath to take it.
5. Provide water cooler at main lobby or lift lobby for us to refill if we want.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Sing Soon Kong
text: Good service.  The staff selva at the gym was very friendly and helpful.  Great experience overall.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Yeong
text:
Always a pleasant experience staying here.  First thing you will notice is the strong air-con when stepping into the lobby and the distinct fragrance used in Royale Chulan properties. There's a doorman at the entrance who opens the door for you each time you exit and enter the hotel. Check-in is fast. Room is a bit dated but spacious and clean with adequate lighting. Essentials like toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner, soap, hair dryer are provided. In the closet, you'll find bedroom slippers, laundry bag, iron and ironing board as well as Muslim prayer mat. WiFi is fast and has good connection. Bed is comfy and clean. Good variety at the breakfast buffet. There's an egg station and roti canai station. Decent coffee from the BonCafe coffee machine. Staff are pleasant, warm and welcoming.

Located in a central location with many cafes, restaurants, bars and cultural sites nearby. Little India is within walking distance. Short walk to the colonial style town hall and municipal building. Enjoy the architecture of the 5 foot way of the shops in the vicinity. So many good food within walking distance- Ali Nasi Lemak Daun Pisang, Norm Cafe, OO White Coffee, Kareem Pasembur, Aunty's Gaik Leans, Jason Nyonya House, Chu Char 1st. There are 2 tea houses along Beach St. For mung beans biscuits, Ghee Hiang is just down the street at the end of Beach St.

Highly recommended for the value, comfort, location and hospitality.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Nathanael Tan
text: This property has seen better days. If it's not because of a conference probably will not select this. Old aged rooms that seems to stick a plaster to prolong it's pain. Small property and for Penang standards food quality is below average for its meals and daily breakfast. Location is an issue that is far from everything and aside to a 7-11 nearby nothing else in the proximity
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Jip
text:
I had my car with me while travelling to Penang Island. So, covered parking and security were important during my stay there. The location of the hotel itself was crucial for an enjoyable time. Thus, Royale Chulan was the perfect choice.

After parking in the multilevel car park annexe building, I made my way to the lobby entrance hidden away from the main street facing the hotel. Peaceful. Checking in was quick and easy. With the room card in one hand and my luggage in the other, I searched for my room. Thick carpet in the corridors leading to guest rooms helped to keep the atmosphere peaceful.

I booked a twin bed room. Unfortunately, the view I had was not ideal. Workers cleaning the rooftop of building next door greeted me when I pulled back the thick curtains. Thankfully, the room itself was cosy and comfortable. The ensuite was clean. That night, I had a good rest. The mattress and pillows were better than most.

Breakfast was provided, and it was a long walk from the hotel lobby. The reason is that the usual dining room was being refurbished. In the temporary breakfast room, tables were a little haphazardly arranged. The dishes on offer were placed on both sides of the entrance. Food quality was acceptable.

The hotel is within walking distance to many local attractions. The Esplanade, the Padang, the City and Town Halls, the bus terminal for bus trips around the city, Fort Cornwallis, Beach Street, Clan Jetties, the street art, the lively Chulia and Armenian Streets. Restaurants, food courts, cafes, and convenience stores are within a few minutes' walk.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: milena rubio
text: Royale Chulan Penang has a great location near the waterfront and George Town’s main sights. The rooms are clean, spacious, and quiet, and the pool and gym are nice extras. The buffet breakfast was great, with a wide variety of options including my favourite Roti Chennai. That said, the service felt more task-oriented than guest-focused, something we noticed across Malaysia, like plates being cleared while we were still eating. Overall, a solid stay if you value location, heritage charm, and a good breakfast, but don’t expect especially warm hospitality.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Trip.com Member
text: The hotel’s facilities were good. Breakfast was another highlight—delicious and with a wide variety of options.The location is ideal, with easy access to local attractions.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

title: Royale Chulan Penang

name: Sophie B Lee
text: Stayed for a conference; facilities in the hall don't seem too worn out compared to the state of the rooms. Three out of four of my sleeping pillows had sandy/dirt water marks on them, the forth had the case inside-out, was it changed from the previous occupant? Service is not too bad but could definitely be better 🙂. Made it difficult for me to get my bottled water just because I opted out of housekeeping for the duration of my stay, why? A/c in my room wasn't really adjusting to the temperature stated on the thermostat. Little things here and there not in mint condition but nothing to shout about. Lunches and dinners really left room for wanting, hardly a spread, definitely not "Penang food", would have gone out if we weren't so busy, breakfast was only slightly better. Gym had out-of-order equipment; enquired on the first day and was told it would be working the next but wasn't the case even after a few days. Pool is salt-water, seems well maintained, gets crowded because of size. Location is good, walking distance to hawkers, some attractions.
title: Royale Chulan Penang

text: I booked this hotel a few weeks ago, requesting a king-sized bed for me and my baby. Upon arrival at the reception, they informed me that my requested room was no longer available and offered to switch to a room with two single beds, which I did not want. That was the first bad experience. Then, the air conditioner in our room was faulty, the children’s facility room was dirty and poorly maintained, the staff were unfriendly, and finally, they double-charged my car for parking. The staff initially said it was RM4 per day, so I should have paid RM8 for two days, but they charged more. When I went to the reception to request a refund, they informed me that my car had not been registered by the staff during my check-in yesterday. This is absolutely terrible, and I will never stay here again.

name: Trip.com Member
text: I am writing to provide feedback following my recent stay at your hotel. Unfortunately, my experience was not up to the standard I had expected.Firstly, the room lacked towels upon my arrival, and I had to call housekeeping to have them sent. This was also happened during my last stays. Additionally, I found that the minibar was not stocked, which I initially addressed by calling reception to request a room change. I was told that instead of moving rooms, housekeeping would send a minibar to my room, but this was not an ideal solution.Furthermore, I noticed that the area around the minibar cabinet had not been properly cleaned, which was disappointing given the otherwise high standards of the hotel.I hope this feedback will be taken into consideration to improve the overall guest experience.
title: Royale Chulan Damansara

name: Trip.com Member
text: I stayed here to pick up my child from camp. I like this hotel mainly because of the breakfast—delicious and lots of choices. The hotel and furniture are a bit old, but it’s okay. Personally, I don’t like carpets, but it’s fine because the location is close to everything.

title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Syafiqah Jawawi
text:
I recently attended a hi-tea event at Royale Chulan Cherating, and while the experience had its highlights, it was a bit of a mixed bag. The setting is absolutely stunning, with a breathtaking view that made for a serene and picturesque afternoon. It’s the perfect spot to relax and soak in the beauty of Cherating.

However, the food was somewhat underwhelming. The variety was decent, but the flavors and quality didn’t quite match the venue’s high standards. While it wasn’t bad, it didn’t stand out as exceptional either.

Overall, the ambiance and view made it worth the visit, but I do hope they elevate the food offerings to match the incredible location.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Kaneson Sivapalan
text: We used to visit this place for our surf trips. However, the trip which we had few days ago was very unpleasant. Our bed in room 3101 chalet was infested with bed bugs. We had to notify the reception at 2am as we started developing itches. We didn’t want to make a fuss in the middle of the night and waited the next day to lodge a complaint. We shared the photos and video of the bed bug evidence to the reception.We were advised to scan the QR code at the reception to leave our feedback instead. It is rather disappointing to be on the receiving end of such hospitality and the chalet team made no effort to explain/speak to us. This has caused a huge distress to us as it did not only spoiled our holiday, but we had to incur additional cost of getting prescription to treat ourselves.  hope the rooms will be property sanitized to prevent similar reoccurrence in future.
title: Royale Chulan Cerating Villa & Chalet (Formerly known as Royale Chulan Cherating)

name: Trip.com Member
text: Location, room comfort, hotel conditionI chose this hotel for its location.my 2 nights stay was a very pleasant experience: comfortable bed and pillows, courteous and helpful staff, clean and generous sized room, plus professional service, efficiency and tranquility for business travel. Recommended!
